~~~A.2.3.5.3 -  Light Agent Primitive - core
~~~content:
~~~The Light Agent Primitive enables users to create Light Agents, which are sub-agents operating on top of the Agent’s Executor Accord, conferring the advantages of Sky GovOps at a lower cost, but without direct access to other Sky Primitives.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~--------------------
~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c9-b408-d07af7f27c84
~~A.2.3.6 -  Ecosystem Upkeep Primitives - section
~~content:
~~Ecosystem Upkeep Primitives ensure that all Agents contribute to long-term ecosystem sustainability. Star Agents must choose between either the Distribution Requirement Primitive or the Market Cap Fee Primitive; whereas the Upkeep Rebate Primitive applies universally to all Star Agents. The term “Ecosystem Upkeep Fees” refers to the upkeep obligation of a Star Agent pursuant to either the Distribution Requirement Primitive or the Market Cap Fee Primitive.
~~hub urls:
~~child ids:
~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-800d-a0e6-d89e3f13d46b
~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-809b-8752-dfe3417d2c3f
~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e9-b825-eb717d401c4a
~~--------------------
~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-809b-8752-dfe3417d2c3f
~~~A.2.3.6.1 -  Distribution Requirement Primitive - core
~~~content:
~~~The Distribution Requirement Primitive requires Agents to periodically buy and distribute 0.25% of their token supply per year. The annual requirement of 0.25% of the token supply is divided into twelve (12) equal monthly distributions. Distributions must occur on the first day of each month, with tokens purchased by the Star Agent on the open market and transferred to an address designated by Sky Core in 
A.2.3.6.1.1 -  Sky Core-Designated Address
. 

Star Agents choose between fulfilling either the Distribution Requirement Primitive or the Market Cap Fee Primitive.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8064-b04d-d9d39e541b37
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80bf-87aa-d310defb29c3
~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8064-b04d-d9d39e541b37
~~~~A.2.3.6.1.1 -  Sky Core-Designated Address - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The address to which tokens must be transferred will be specified in a future iteration of the Atlas.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80bf-87aa-d310defb29c3
~~~~A.2.3.6.1.2 -  Calculation of Distributed Tokens - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The value of the distributed tokens is calculated as the number of tokens distributed, multiplied by the Time-Weighted Average Price (TWAP) of the token over the 24-hour period ending at 23:59 UTC on the last day of each month, immediately preceding the distribution event. This value is applied in the rebate calculation under the Upkeep Rebate Primitive. See 
A.2.3.6.3 -  Upkeep Rebate Primitive
. 
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~--------------------
~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e9-b825-eb717d401c4a
~~~A.2.3.6.2 -  Market Cap Fee Primitive - core
~~~content:
~~~The Market Cap Fee Primitive requires Star Agents to pay an annual fee equivalent to 0.30% of their market capitalization to Sky, accounted for monthly. The annual fee of 0.30% of the market capitalization is divided into twelve (12) equal monthly payments, equating to 0.025% of the market capitalization per month. Payments must occur on the first day of each month, with the fee transferred to an address designated by Sky Core in 
A.2.3.6.2.1 -  Sky Core-Designated Address
. 

Star Agents choose between fulfilling either the Distribution Requirement Primitive or the Market Cap Fee Primitive.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8062-96b3-f208c65d13f8
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8064-b947-c7d25a3e0786
~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8062-96b3-f208c65d13f8
~~~~A.2.3.6.2.1 -  Sky Core-Designated Address - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The address to which the fee must be transferred will be specified in a future iteration of the Atlas.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8064-b947-c7d25a3e0786
~~~~A.2.3.6.2.2 -  Valuation - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The market capitalization is determined as the total token supply multiplied by the TWAP of the token over the 24-hour period ending at 23:59 UTC on the last day of each month, immediately preceding the payment event. This value is applied in the rebate calculation under the Upkeep Rebate Primitive. See 
A.2.3.6.3 -  Upkeep Rebate Primitive
. 
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~--------------------
~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-800d-a0e6-d89e3f13d46b
~~~A.2.3.6.3 -  Upkeep Rebate Primitive - core
~~~content:
~~~The Upkeep Rebate Primitive allows a Star Agent (”Holding Agent”) to claim a rebate on its Ecosystem Upkeep Fees when it holds any portion of the token supply of another Star Agent (”Issuing Agent”).

Ecosystem Upkeep Fees are accounted on a monthly basis. The Upkeep Rebate is calculated on the same cadence per Holding Agent as follows:

(1) The Holding Agent’s share of the Issuing Agent’s token supply at the time the Issuing Agent pays its Ecosystem Upkeep Fees, multiplied by
(2) The total monthly Ecosystem Upkeep Fees paid by the Issuing Agent. For a Star Agent deploying the Distribution Requirement Primitive, the value of its total monthly Ecosystem Upkeep Fee is calculated pursuant to 
A.2.3.6.1.2 -  Calculation of Distributed Tokens
. For a Star Agent deploying the Market Cap Fee Primitive, the value of its total monthly Ecosystem Upkeep Fee is calculated pursuant to 
A.2.3.6.1.2 -  Calculation of Distributed Tokens
. 

This resulting rebate amount is applied against the Holding Agent’s Ecosystem Upkeep Fees due in the calendar month immediately following the Issuing Agent’s payment.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~--------------------
~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-802a-a617-cf28defc52b3
~~A.2.3.7 -  SkyLink Primitives - section
~~content:
~~SkyLink Primitives are Sky Primitives that are technical infrastructure that extends the Sky Protocol. SkyLink Primitives are built autonomously by Star Agents, but owned by Sky Core and shared among all Star Agents. Star Agents are reimbursed for the cost of setting up SkyLink Primitives and given additional first-mover incentives.
~~hub urls:
~~child ids:
~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8076-9c0c-f3eb603e2ce5
~~--------------------
~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8076-9c0c-f3eb603e2ce5
~~~A.2.3.7.1 -  Token SkyLink Primitive - core
~~~content:
~~~The Token SkyLink Primitive allows users to bridge USDS, sUSDS, SKY, or an Agent token to new blockchains and enables other multichain features.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8046-ba7b-e57406b40621
~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b4-a762-dc61ee4876d1

~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b4-a762-dc61ee4876d1
~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1 -  Token SkyLink Process Definition - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define the Process Definition for initial setup and ongoing management of the Token SkyLink Primitive.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8034-ab57-d93c14364400
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-808f-9da5-d0cdb6cc50af
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8034-ab57-d93c14364400
~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1 -  Token SkyLink Setup Process Definition - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The documents herein define the process for setting up an Instance of the Token SkyLink Primitive.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8065-a673-e841a9c10b76
~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-806b-aac9-c679d10fd266
~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e4-9f53-ce295a7b6ef2
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e4-9f53-ce295a7b6ef2
~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.1 -  Token SkyLink Setup Real World Agreements And Planning - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The documents herein define the preliminary, off-chain human coordination stage of setting up an Instance of the Token SkyLink Primitive.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-800c-bd39-c38a2d63637b
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8022-a085-e004a3a4f3a4
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-807c-9668-d7063883fc6e
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-800c-bd39-c38a2d63637b
~~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.1.1 -  Token SkyLink Setup Target Chain Identification And Feasibility Analysis - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Star Agent researches potential target blockchains for token bridging, including evaluation of user base, DeFi ecosystem, and bridging security requirements. The Star Agent confirms that the target chain supports LayerZero or can be integrated easily with the LayerZero Omnichain Fungible Token standard. The Star Agent also estimates potential use of the token on the target chain to justify the bridge deployment and audit costs. The output of this step is a preliminary decision to proceed with deploying a bridge to the target chain including a scope of work for the bridge deployment and estimated audit costs.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8022-a085-e004a3a4f3a4
~~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.1.2 -  Token SkyLink Setup Initial Alignment With Operational GovOps - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Star Agent presents the bridging plan to Operational GovOps, including a technical summary, proposed timeline, and estimate of audit costs. The Star Agent and Operational GovOps also discuss any guidelines in the Atlas or the Agent Artifact that may affect bridging. The Star Agent receives early feedback on the plan and modifies it accordingly. The output of this step is an informal agreement to proceed with developing a bridge deployment along with any documented conditions or feedback from Operational GovOps.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-807c-9668-d7063883fc6e
~~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.1.3 -  Token SkyLink Setup Audit Preparation And Proposal Of Costs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Star Agent contacts a reputable third-party security audit firm for reviewing the bridge implementation. The Star Agent negotiates audit scope, timeline, and fees with the audit firm. The Star Agent documents the projected cost for the bridge, including development, audit, and deployment costs, for future reimbursement. The outcome of this step is a formal agreement with the audit firm and a detailed cost breakdown for bridge deployment and auditing.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8065-a673-e841a9c10b76
~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.2 -  Token SkyLink Setup Codification and Validation - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The documents herein define how agreements to setup an Instance of the Token SkyLink Primitive are codified and validated in the Powerhouse system and how governance votes happen.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ca-9bb2-f397601f1ae8
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80cb-b2bb-fa7c207c0b39
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80dc-b765-fd14a82a5cda
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ca-9bb2-f397601f1ae8
~~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.2.1 -  Agent Inputs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Star Agent drafts an update to the Star Agent Artifact adding the Token SkyLink to the list of active Token SkyLink deployments and including the information specified in 
A.2.3.7.1.2.2 -  List of Active Token SkyLink Deployments
. The Star Agent submits the draft to the Powerhouse system. The output of this step is a draft Star Agent Artifact update in the Powerhouse system.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80dc-b765-fd14a82a5cda
~~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.2.2 -  Validation And Off-Chain Vote - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Operational Executor Facilitator reviews the proposal to ensure that it is complete and aligned with the Atlas. The Operational Executor Facilitator then initiates an off-chain snapshot vote, following the quorum and majority rules in the Star Agent Artifact. When complete, the result of the vote is recorded in the Powerhouse system. The output of this step is the snapshot vote result recorded in the Powerhouse system.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80cb-b2bb-fa7c207c0b39
~~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.2.3 -  Official Update of Artifact - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~If the Token SkyLink Invocation is successfully approved, the Operational Executor Facilitator finalizes and publishes the update to the Star Agent Artifact, making it effective in the Atlas. The output of this step is an updated Star Agent Artifact with the Token SkyLink Instance Activated.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-806b-aac9-c679d10fd266
~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.3 -  Token SkyLink Setup Deployment - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The documents herein define how the deployment of an Instance of the Token SkyLink Primitive is executed on-chain.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-803a-818e-f5cbd76dbf1c
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-807a-931a-c2dcaa57079c
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-803a-818e-f5cbd76dbf1c
~~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.3.1 -  Token SkyLink Setup Bridge Deployment And Initial Audit - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Star Agent, through Operational GovOps, deploys the Token SkyLink contract on the target chain. The Star Agent shares the Token SkyLink contract’s final address with the audit firm for verification. Operational GovOps confirms that the bridge contract address and references match the updated Star Agent Artifact. The audit firm completes and updates the bridging audit registry with the results of the audit. The output of this step is a deployed bridge contract with audit results uploaded to the bridging audit registry.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-807a-931a-c2dcaa57079c
~~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.1.3.2 -  Token SkyLink Setup Activation On New Chain - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~Core GovOps formalizes the audit results with a Sky Core Executive Vote to fully activate bridging functionality. Operational GovOps updates the Star Agent Reimbursement Module to begin counting any bridged tokens toward the incremental reward. The output of this step is fully enabled bridging on the target chain with the Star Agent Reimbursement Module updated to track bridging based rewards.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-808f-9da5-d0cdb6cc50af
~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.2 -  Token SkyLink Ongoing Management - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The documents herein define the process for managing an Instance of the Token SkyLink Primitive.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-809c-ac4a-e6af9f79422d
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-809c-ac4a-e6af9f79422d
~~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.1.2.1 -  Token SkyLink Management Settlement Cycle - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~During each settlement cycle, the Star Agent Reimbursement Module tallies the total token bridging volume on the new chain. The Star Agent Reimbursement Module calculates the reimbursement due for bridge development costs as a percent of the token bridging volume, in addition to normal Accessibility Rewards if applicable. Core GovOps executes a payment to the Star Agent for the amount due for reimbursement of bridge development costs, to the extent that such costs have not already been fully reimbursed. Core GovOps updates the Powerhouse system to reflect the amount of bridge development costs that have been reimbursed.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8046-ba7b-e57406b40621
~~~~A.2.3.7.1.2 -  Token SkyLink Input Requirements - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define the required inputs for a valid Token SkyLink Primitive. If any input is noncompliant or omitted, the Primitive will be invalidated and the SkyLink deployment will not move forward.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8070-9bef-e7a0e78f0454
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-808d-b275-fd272a665592
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-808d-b275-fd272a665592
~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.2.1 -  Token SkyLink Activation Status - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The Token SkyLink Primitive must be Globally Activated.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8070-9bef-e7a0e78f0454
~~~~~A.2.3.7.1.2.2 -  List of Active Token SkyLink Deployments - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The
 Token SkyLink Primitive must list each active Token SkyLink deployment. The listing must include the following information: (1), the token being bridged, (2) the target chain of the bridge, (3) the address of the bridge contract on the Ethereum Mainnet, (4) the address of the bridge contract on the target chain, (5) the audit of the bridge contract, (6) the bridge parameters, (7) the total bridge deployment and audit costs, and (8) the amount of bridge deployment and audit costs that have been reimbursed to date.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8014-91cd-e129bd70eafd
~~A.2.3.8 -  Demand Side Stablecoin Primitives - section
~~content:
~~Demand Side Stablecoin Primitives are Sky Primitives that target demand generation for USDS. Star Agents can create and control multiple instances of these Primitives which exist as technical infrastructure incentivizing the adoption or usage of USDS by end users or third parties.
~~hub urls:
~~child ids:

~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b4-873c-ec532edc750c
~~~A.2.3.8.1 - Accessibility Reward Primitive - core
~~~content:
~~~The documents herein govern the Accessibility Reward Primitive.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-805d-89c0-d1e906f1b0dc
~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b4-bb9b-f542e56dabae
~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-805d-89c0-d1e906f1b0dc
~~~~A.2.3.8.1.1 - Introduction - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein provide an introduction to the Accessibility Reward Primitive.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8083-90b3-e9b92abb01b5
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80a0-9481-ed2a184029aa
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80f4-a2c6-e7baca51cf44
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8083-90b3-e9b92abb01b5
~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.1.1 - Purpose - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The purpose of the Accessibility Reward is to incentivize Star Agents and third parties to drive USDS adoption by providing a financial reward to these actors for all USDS and sUSDS balances attributable to them.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80a0-9481-ed2a184029aa
~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.1.2 - Allowed Number Of Instances - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~Multiple instances of the Accessibility Reward Primitive are allowed. Each instance corresponds to an Accessibility Reward program with an associated Accessibility Reward Code.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80f4-a2c6-e7baca51cf44
~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.1.3 - Multi-Instance Coordinator Document - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~An Agent Artifact that has more than one active instance of the Accessibility Reward Primitive is not required to have a 
Multi-Instance Coordinator Document
, since each Instance can be managed independently. 
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b4-bb9b-f542e56dabae
~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2 - Global Specification - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The requirements herein apply universally across all possible deployments of the Accessibility Reward Primitive by Star Agents. They include the steps that Agents must take to deploy the Primitive, including Global Activation of the Primitive, Instance Invocation, and ongoing management of the Primitive Instance(s).

~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1 - Integrator Program - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~Integrators are actors that offer access to the Sky Protocol via their frontends or infrastructure. The documents herein define the Integrator Program, which includes the Accessibility Reward and Integration Boost. (Base elements specific to the Integration Boost Primitive are defined in 
A.2.3.8.2.2.1 - Base Elements
)
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8020-8824-db33079dc737

~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.1 - Integrator Requirements - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The documents herein define the requirements for Integrators.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-801f-9398-cb61c7033ee5
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8086-b28a-ec64d02bac42
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8086-b28a-ec64d02bac42
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.1.1 - Alignment - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The Integrator must be aligned with Sky’s overall strategy regarding promoting adoption of USDS. In the near term, this determination of a prospective or current Integrator’s alignment with Sky’s overall strategy is made by Operational GovOps in consultation with Ecosystem Actor Viridian Advisors. In the future Operational GovOps may make this determination themselves or consult with another actor to do so. Sky Core may choose whether to maintain an Integrator’s Reward Code in its sole and absolute discretion.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-801f-9398-cb61c7033ee5
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.1.2 - Compliance With Local Laws And Regulations As A Condition Precedent To Integrators Receiving Accessibility Rewards - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~This document and its subdocuments define the jurisdictional compliance rules applicable to Integrators that operate user-facing frontends that integrate with, and thus offer access to, the Sky Protocol and receive Accessibility Rewards.

Integrators are solely responsible for complying with all relevant legal and regulatory requirements related to their participation in the Integrator Program. Integrators represent and warrant that their participation and activities under the Integrator Program are and will remain in full compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.

In connection with integrating with, and thereby providing access to, the Sky Protocol, Integrators must operate their frontends and infrastructure in compliance with all relevant legal and regulatory requirements in the jurisdictions applicable to their services. This requires compliance with all relevant legal and regulatory requirements in relation to frontend operations, marketing, and promotions in the jurisdictions where the Integrator provides access to the Sky Protocol through the integration.

An Integrator’s right to participate in the Integrator Program is contingent upon its ongoing compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-803f-914e-d882e057231c
~~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e0-aa4c-db76c0e5e96e
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-803f-914e-d882e057231c
~~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.1.2.1 - Consequence For Integrator Non-Compliance With Local Laws And Regulations - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~Sky Ecosystem Governance, in its absolute and unilateral discretion, retains the right to withhold, revoke, or demand immediate repayment of any and all Accessibility Rewards from any Integrator that is determined, suspected, or alleged to be in violation of the Atlas or any legal, regulatory, or other obligations associated with its integration with, and provision of access to, the Sky Protocol.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e0-aa4c-db76c0e5e96e
~~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.1.2.2 - Removal From Integrator Program - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~If Sky Ecosystem Governance removes an Integrator from the Integrator Program, Operational GovOps must remove the Integrator from the list of Current Integrators in 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.5.1 - Current Integrators
 and deactivate the Instances of the Accessibility Reward and Integration Boost Primitive associated with them.

~~~~~~~~~child ids:

~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8020-8824-db33079dc737
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.2 - Integrator Applications - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The documents herein define the process for applying to become an Integrator.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8095-8e4e-cbac9c3c3f43

~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ee-9ed8-de7602a696ae
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.2.1 - Near Term Process - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~In the near term, applications are made directly to Ecosystem Actor Viridian Advisors. Viridian Advisors must create and maintain a thread on the Sky Forum for Integrator Applications. Viridian Advisors reviews applications and coordinates with Star Agents interested in working with specific applicants. Viridian Advisors issues Reward Codes to approved applicants.

The Active Data is updated as follows:
• The Responsible Party is Viridian Advisors.
• The Update Process must follow the protocol for ‘Direct Edit’.

~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.3 - Integrator Onboarding - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The documents herein define the process for onboarding new Integrators.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80de-b7db-c8f80321d680
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e5-99e6-e730c5662f50
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e5-99e6-e730c5662f50
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.3.1 - Near Term Process - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The near term Integrator Onboarding process is as follows. When a Star Agent’s Invocation of the Accessibility Reward Primitive involves an actor who is not yet an approved Integrator, that actor must submit an Integrator Application to Viridian Advisors. Viridian Advisors determines, in consultation with Operational GovOps, whether the Integrator Requirements are met, and if so issues a Reward Code to the applicant. After the Reward Code has been issued, the Invocation of the Primitive may proceed.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80de-b7db-c8f80321d680
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.3.2 - Long Term Process - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~In the long term, Operational GovOps will review Integrator applications and determine whether the prospective partner satisfies the Integrator Requirements; if so, Operational GovOps issues a Reward Code. Operational GovOps may contract with Viridian Advisors or another actor to perform the work of reviewing applications and issuing Reward Codes.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8098-b627-d8a8d4e1d9bc
~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2 - Reward Codes - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The documents herein define base elements related to Reward Codes. 
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80c7-946a-d1166862f718
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ce-b78d-e2e8a8cdeb68
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80d1-ba01-cb19f5bec0d2
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ce-b78d-e2e8a8cdeb68
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2.1 - Assignment - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The documents herein define the process for assigning Reward Codes.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b0-b83a-e532e7f8fa7c
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80cb-aaf5-f85961de57a2
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80cb-aaf5-f85961de57a2
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2.1.1 - Near Term Process - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~In the near term, Reward Codes are assigned by Ecosystem Actor Viridian Advisors.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b0-b83a-e532e7f8fa7c
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2.1.2 - Long Term Process - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~In the long term, Reward Codes are assigned by Operational GovOps. Operational GovOps may contract with Viridian Advisors or another Ecosystem Actor to perform this work for them, at the discretion of Operational GovOps.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80d1-ba01-cb19f5bec0d2
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2.2 - Marking - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~To be eligible for the Accessibility Reward, USDS balances must be “marked” with a Reward Code using the agreed-on Tracking Methodology.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-801e-a1b5-ebc7e87f9cbd
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8042-8601-fe7eea7098d7
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80d5-ba6a-c12f7df61339
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80de-9158-e34c71a37e4a
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e0-a452-c46e188cf0bf
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80d5-ba6a-c12f7df61339
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2.2.1 - Ethereum Mainnet General Tracking Methodology - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The general Tracking Methodology for Ethereum Mainnet is to specify the Reward Code as a parameter to depositing USDS into the Sky Savings Rate contract or Token Rewards contracts. This on-chain deposit data is then combined with withdrawal data. In the interim, this data is further processed by Ecosystem Actor Viridian Advisors to estimate net deposits associated with the Reward Code on a First In First Out (FIFO) basis. In the long term, Operational Executor Agents will wholly manage this process. 
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8042-8601-fe7eea7098d7
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2.2.2 - Ethereum Mainnet CoW Swap Tracking Methodology - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The Tracking Methodology for CoW Swap on the Ethereum Mainnet is the same as the general process for the Ethereum Mainnet, with the exception that events on CoW Swap’s decentralized network of solvers are tracked instead.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e0-a452-c46e188cf0bf
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2.2.3 - Base Tracking Methodology - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The Tracking Methodology for Base is to specify the Reward Code as a parameter in calls to the Base PSM contract. Conversions from USDS or USDC to sUSDS are considered “deposits” and net deposits are calculated using an approach similar to that on Ethereum Mainnet.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80de-9158-e34c71a37e4a
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2.2.4 - Alternative Tracking Methodologies - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The Tracking Methodologies specified above are not exclusive. Star Agents and Operational GovOps can develop additional Tracking Methodologies, so long as those methodologies reasonably estimate USDS balances that are attributable to the holder of the Reward Code and there is no possibility that the same USDS balances could be “double counted” for multiple Reward Code holders. Tracking methodologies must be based on either (1) on-chain data or (2) off-chain data that can be independently verified or attested to by a third party.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-801e-a1b5-ebc7e87f9cbd
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2.2.5 - Lifetime - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~USDS balances are eligible for an Accessibility Reward for a period of ten (10) years from the date of the event marking the USDS balance with the Reward Code. The date of the marking event is determined based on the Primitive Instance’s specified Tracking Methodology.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80c7-946a-d1166862f718
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.2.3 - Management - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~In the near term, Ecosystem Actor Viridian Advisors manages the list of Actor Reward Codes. In the future, all current Integrators and onboarding Integrators must be specified in 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.5 - Current And Onboarding Integrators
 so that Star Agents, through their Operational Executor Agents, can onboard new partners themselves without having to go through a single party.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8080-bd02-d93578337aed
~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.3 - Fees - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The documents herein define the methodology for calculating the Accessibility Reward due to the reward recipient for USDS and sUSDS balances attributable to them.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80a7-9f4b-f610a10ef6bf
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80df-8db3-ee80a36a5359
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80df-8db3-ee80a36a5359
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.3.1 - Fee For USDS and sUSDS Balances - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The reward recipient is entitled to a 0.1% Accessibility Reward annualized on all USDS and sUSDS balances attributable to them.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80a7-9f4b-f610a10ef6bf
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.3.2 - Star Agent Management Fee - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~In addition to the fee specified above, the Star Agent that Invoked the Accessibility Reward Primitive is entitled to a 0.1% management fee annualized on all USDS and sUSDS balances that use the Reward Code.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8036-a579-f862d049c95d
~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.4 - Rewards Distribution - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The documents herein define base elements of the Accessibility Reward Primitive related to distribution of Accessibility Rewards.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8004-9f94-e8f9a125dce0
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-803d-af4a-c64cd5f11332
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-808d-96e2-c06936f299fd
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e9-bed4-df71121a7d93
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-808d-96e2-c06936f299fd
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.4.1 - Reward Cadence - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Accessibility Reward is calculated and distributed on a monthly basis.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8004-9f94-e8f9a125dce0
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.4.2 - Reward Payment - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Accessibility Reward payment for each month is equal to 

(1) the average balance over the month, times 
(2) the annual Accessibility Reward Fee specified in 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.3 - Fees
, divided by 
(3) twelve (12).

The Accessibility Reward Fee specified in 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.3 - Fees
 includes all of the following elements:

1) Fees for USDS and sUSDS Balances specified in 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.3.1 - Fee For USDS and sUSDS Balances
; and
2) the Star Agent Management Fee specified in 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.3.2 - Star Agent Management Fee
.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e9-bed4-df71121a7d93
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.4.3 - Treasury Management - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The documents herein define the treasury management process.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8022-92a2-ceb9e4827fb9
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8071-9f1f-e1ada4775b61
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8022-92a2-ceb9e4827fb9
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.4.3.1 - Near Term Process - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~In the near term, Viridian Advisors calculates the Accessibility Reward on behalf of the Support Facilitators. The Accessibility Facilitators then pay the Accessibility Reward from the Accessibility Reward Controller Wallet located on the Ethereum Mainnet at 
0x05f471262d15eeca4059dade070e5bed509a4e73
 within seven (7) days of the end of every month. The wallet is funded from the Launch Project and may be topped up at the request of the Accessibility Facilitators, up to 3 million USDS.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8071-9f1f-e1ada4775b61
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.4.3.2 - Long Term Process - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~In the long term, Operational GovOps calculates the Accessibility Reward for each month. Operational GovOps then pays the Accessibility Reward recipient from its Buffer. Later Sky Core reimburses the Operational Agent Buffer for the amount paid as part of the Settlement Cycle. This minimizes the role of Sky Core in Accessibility Reward payments and emphasizes the primary role of the Operational Executor Agent, acting through Operational GovOps, in implementing the Sky Primitives. The process is specified in further detail in 
A.2.3.8.1.2.4.1 - Routine Protocol
.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-803d-af4a-c64cd5f11332
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.4.4 - Payment Errors - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~If it is discovered that previous Accessibility Reward calculations were made erroneously, underpayments are resolved retroactively. In cases where an Integrator was overpaid, the Star Agent associated with the Integrator must reimburse Sky the overpayment amount and can use future Accessibility Rewards that the Integrator earns to reimburse itself.

~~~~~~~child ids:

~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.5.1 - Current Integrators - activeDataController
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~Current Integrators are Integrators who have a Reward Code specified in an 
Active
 Instance of the Accessibility Reward Primitive. The list of Current Integrators is defined as Active Data.

The Active Data is updated as follows:
• The Responsible Party is Operational GovOps.
• The Update Process must follow the protocol for ‘Direct Edit’.

~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.1.5.2 - Onboarding Integrators - activeDataController
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~Onboarding Integrators are actors whose application to the Integrator Program has been approved, but are specified in an Instance of the Accessibility Reward Primitive or Integration Boost Primitive that is “Pending”, or is not 
Active
 yet. The list of Onboarding Integrators is defined as Active Data.

The Active Data is updated as follows:
• The Responsible Party is Operational GovOps.
• The Update Process must follow the protocol for ‘Direct Edit’.

~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.3.1.1.2 - Dependencies - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~This process is dependent on a Star Agent Globally Activating the Accessibility Reward Primitive pursuant to 
A.2.3.8.1.2.2 - Global Activation
.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80db-a23c-d3e658466dc1
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.3.1.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The process flow is defined herein.

• The Star Agent identifies an opportunity to drive USDS adoption through an Accessibility Reward to either 1) reward an existing Integrator for driving USDS adoption or 2) incentivize a new actor to onboard as an Integrator to drive USDS adoption.

• Existing Integrators

    ◦ The Star Agent and the third party, if applicable, develop a plan to track USDS utilization attributable to the actor using either on-chain or off-chain data.

• Prospective Integrators

    ◦ Near Term process:
        • The Prospective Integrator must first apply to the Integrator program and be approved by Viridian Advisors per 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.2.1 - Near Term Process
.  Post approval, Viridian Advisors issues a Reward Code to the Integrator.
        • The Star Agent and the third party develop a plan to track USDS utilization attributable to the actor using either on-chain or off-chain data.

    ◦ Long Term process:
        • The Prospective Integrator must first apply to the Integrator program and be approved by Operational GovOps pursuant to 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.2.2 - Long Term Process
. Post approval, Operational GovOps issues a Reward Code to the Integrator.
        • The Star Agent develops a plan to track USDS utilization attributable to it using either on-chain or off-chain data. Where applicable, the plan should include how the Star Agent will support the prospective Integrator in including the Reward Code in their on-chain infrastructure.

• The Star Agent may also be (or choose to be) an Integrator itself and deploy a Reward Code on its frontend to earn the Accessibility Reward.

    ◦ Near Term process:
        •
 
If the Star Agent is not already an approved Integrator, it must apply to the Program and be approved by Viridian Advisors. Post approval, Viridian Advisors issues a Reward Code to the Star Agent.
        • The Star Agent develops a plan to track USDS utilization attributable to it using either on-chain or off-chain data.

    ◦ Long Term process:
        • The Star Agent must first apply to the Integrator program and be approved by Operational GovOps pursuant to 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1.2.2 - Long Term Process
. Post approval, Operational GovOps issues a Reward Code to the Star Agent.
        • The Star Agent develops a plan to track USDS utilization attributable to it using either on-chain or off-chain data.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-805f-b64a-d23cd23a45e9
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.3.1.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The required Primitive Inputs for this process are defined herein and organized in sequential stages.


• Drafting of Initial Planning Document

    ◦ Create 
Initial Planning Document

        • Updated fields
            • 
Status

                ◦ New value: set to 
Drafting

            • 
Integrator

                ◦ New Value: set to Integrator Name
            • 
Reward Code

                ◦ New Value: set to Reward Code
            • 
Tracking Methodology

                ◦ New value: populate with details for tracking utilization
            • 
Custom Instance Parameters

                ◦ New Value: populate with details for any custom parameters
        • Responsible Party: Star Agent Team
        • Trigger - Required Output: After Star Agent's 
Initial planning document
 Status is set to 
Drafting
 
• Initial Planning Document Triggered For GovOps review
    ◦ Edit 
Initial Planning Document

        • Updated fields
            • 
Tracking Methodology

                ◦ New value: updated content, as applicable
            • 
Status

                ◦ New value: set to 
Ready for GovOps Review

        • Responsible party: Star Agent
        • Trigger - Required Output: After Star Agent's 
Initial planning document
 Status is set to 
Ready for GovOps review
.

Initial planning document

Planning

Instance Configuration Document

Instance Configuration
 Document for prospective Primitive Instance. The Instance Configuration Document contains a

~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:

~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-802e-90b7-cf8102318b7c
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.3.2.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The process flow is defined herein:

• Operational GovOps reviews the 
Initial Planning Document
 to ensure:

    ◦ Operational GovOps has the ability to operationalize the proposed tracking mechanism, and

    ◦ The proposed tracking mechanism accurately reflects USDS usage attributable to the actor and there is no possibility that rewards could be “double counted” (i.e. multiple actors being paid for the same USDS balance).

• Operational GovOps submits its feedback into the 
Operational GovOps Review Document
 (created at Create 
Operational GovOps Review Document
.) along with suggested changes, if any.

• The Star Agent incorporates feedback from Operational GovOps and edits its 
Initial Planning Document
 as needed.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8045-a815-d3b1f1965af3

~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The following inputs must be submitted into the Primitive using the Powerhouse interface.

• Create 
Operational GovOps Review Document
.
        •Updated fields
            • 
Initial Planning Document

                ◦ New Value: automatically links to respective Document
            • 
Feedback Summary

                ◦ New Value: GovOps populates with its review commentary and suggested changes that are agreed to by Agent and GovOps, if any.
            • Responsible party: Operational GovOps.

~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.3.3.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The process flow is defined herein:

• The Star Agent creates the 
Artifact Edit Draft
 Document and works to finalize its draft of the Artifact Edit per discussions with Operational GovOps.

• When draft is finalized, the Star Agent triggers the creation of the 
Artifact Edit Proposal
, which inherits content from the finalized 
Artifact Edit Draft
 Document.

• The Star Agent submits the 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document to the Powerhouse system.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8084-b0c4-c72296c91de0
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.3.3.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The required Primitive Inputs for this process are defined herein and implemented in sequential stages.

• Agent creates 
Artifact Edit Draft
 document; drafting in progress:
    ◦ Edit 
Artifact Edit Draft

        • Updated fields
            • Status
                ◦ New value: set to 
In Progress

            • Content
                ◦ New value: populate with drafted content

• Agent finalizes 
Artifact Edit Draft

    ◦ Edit 
Artifact Edit Draft

        • Updated fields
            • Status
                ◦ New value: set to 
Draft Finalized


• Powerhouse System Creates 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document
    ◦ Updated fields
        • Content
            • New value: Inherits data from Artifact Edit Draft content field.
    ◦ Responsible party: Operational GovOps [if not automated]

• Agent submits 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document to Powerhouse system
    ◦ Updated fields
        • Status:
            • New value: set to  
Pending Facilitator Review

    ◦ Responsible party: Agent

~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-807d-b5d5-f521ff6bbe13
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.3.4.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The process flow is defined herein.

• The Operational Facilitator reviews the 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 to ensure alignment with the Sky Core Atlas and the Agent Artifact.

• Where the Proposal is determined to be aligned, the Operational Facilitator updates the 
Artifact Edit Proposal
  Document to reflect their approval and commentary, if applicable.

• Where the Proposal is determined to be misaligned, the Operational Facilitator updates the 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 document to reflect their rejection and commentary. Commentary is required where the Operational Facilitator rejects the proposal for misalignment.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80a5-b8bc-ce861b63248f
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.3.4.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The required Primitive Inputs to this process are defined herein and organized as two mutually exclusive pathways. Once the Review outcome is determined by the Facilitator, the corresponding Pathway is followed to the exclusion of the other.

• Operational Facilitator Approves Proposal
    ◦ Edit 
Artifact Edit Proposal

        • Updated fields
            • 
Operational Facilitator Review/Review Decision

                ◦ New value: set to 
Approved

            • 
Commentary

                ◦ New value (optional): populate with reasoning for Approval
            • 
Status

                ◦ New value: set to 
Proposal Approved by Facilitator
 [automated]
        • Responsible party: Operational Facilitator
        • Trigger-Process: 
A.2.3.8.1.2.3.5 - Process Definition For Offchain Vote
 

• Operational Facilitator Rejects proposal
    ◦ Edit 
Artifact Edit Proposal

        ◦ Updated fields
            • 
Operational Facilitator Review/Review Decision

                ◦ New value: set to 
Rejected

            • 
Commentary

                ◦ New value (required): populate with reasoning for Rejection
            • 
Status

                ◦ New value: set to 
Proposal Rejected By Facilitator
 [automated]
        ◦ Responsible party: Operational Facilitator

~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.3.5.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The process flow for this process is defined herein:

• Using the finalized 
Atlas Edit Proposal
 content, the Operational Facilitator sets up an offchain Snapshot vote.

• Star Agent token holders vote on the proposal.

• After the voting concludes, the Operational Facilitator records the result of the vote in the Powerhouse system.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e7-9b3b-fd51985dc372
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.3.5.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The required Primitive Inputs to this process are defined herein.

• After Facilitator prepares Snapshot vote:
    ◦ Edit 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document
        • Updated fields
            • Status
                ◦ New value: set to 
Pending Poll

            • Off-chain Snapshot
                ◦ New value: Populate with link to the official Snapshot page
        • Responsible party: Operational Facilitator

• Mutually Exclusive Input Pathways: The two Primitive Inputs below are mutually exclusive pathways. Once the vote concludes, the corresponding Pathway is followed to the exclusion of the other.

    ◦ Proposal Passes
        • Edit 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document
            • Update fields
                ◦ Status
                    • New value: set to 
Poll Approved

            • Responsible party: Operational Facilitator.
            • Trigger - Required Output: Proposal Passes

    ◦ Proposal Fails
        • Updated fields
            • Edit 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document
                ◦ Status
                    • New value: set to 
Poll Rejected

            • Responsible party: Operational Facilitator.
            • Trigger - Required Output: Proposal Fails

~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.4.1.1.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The process flow is defined herein:

• Operational GovOps calculates the eligible USDS and sUSDS balances using the Tracking Methodology specified in the Primitive Instance.

• Operational GovOps calculates the Accessibility Reward due based on the USDS and sUSDS balances and the Accessibility Reward formula for each.

• Operational GovOps updates the Powerhouse system with both the underlying data and their calculations.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ec-bb4f-e8ed4604a9e8
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.1.2.4.1.1.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The required Primitive Inputs to this process are specified herein.

• Edit 
Accessibility Reward Payments
 Document (Active Data)
    ◦ Updated fields
        • Status
            • New value: set to 
In Progress

        • Underlying data
            • New value: populate with underlying data used to calculate the eligible USDS and sUSDS balances
        • Eligible USDS balance
            • New value: populate with calculated value
        • Eligible sUSDS balance
            • New value: populate with calculated value
        • Accessibility Reward Due
            • New value: populate with calculated value.
    ◦ Responsible party: Operational GovOps.
    ◦ Trigger-Process:

~~~A.2.3.8.2 - Integration Boost Primitive - core
~~~content:
~~~The documents herein govern the Integration Boost Primitive.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-802a-a6a4-e52856c2d6b0
~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8096-bf17-edcc355dfcbb
~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-802a-a6a4-e52856c2d6b0
~~~~A.2.3.8.2.1 - Introduction - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein provide an introduction to the Integration Boost Primitive.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8053-9854-ed25a20fefe1
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-805e-ac85-ed42d1a3c4cd
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ce-95b6-f268c4267e52
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ce-95b6-f268c4267e52
~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.1.1 - Purpose - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The Integration Boost Primitive provides a low complexity version of the Sky Savings Rate to integration partners that hold USDS or lending markets that integrate USDS.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-805e-ac85-ed42d1a3c4cd
~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.1.2 - Allowed Number Of Instances - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~Multiple instances of the Integration Boost Primitive are allowed. Each instance corresponds to an Integration Boost program.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8053-9854-ed25a20fefe1
~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.1.3 - Multi-Instance Coordinator Document - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~An Agent Artifact that has more than one active instance of the Integration Boost Primitive is not required to have a 
Multi-Instance Coordinator Document
, since each Instance can be managed independently. 
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8096-bf17-edcc355dfcbb
~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2 - Global Specification - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The requirements herein apply universally across all possible deployments of the Integration Boost Primitive by Star Agents. They include the steps that Agents must take to deploy the Primitive, including Global Activation of the Primitive, Instance Invocation, and ongoing management of the Primitive Instance(s).
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8036-97ce-ef9498d6a404
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8081-81a1-e6ee8f948733
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-809b-9e5f-f008ae574b3e
~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80f6-b6e2-dcc21d43f842
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8081-81a1-e6ee8f948733
~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1 - Base Elements - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The documents herein define the base elements of the Integration Boost Primitive.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8004-8fe0-ff163fa25192
~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8018-a742-e390d93817de
~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-802f-83b2-d9886c405931
~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b9-9a79-d4760cafc9dc
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-802f-83b2-d9886c405931
~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.1 - Integration Boost Partners - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The Integration Boost is provided to DeFi protocol partners that allow users to deposit USDS balances. Sky makes payments to Integration Boost partners equal to the Sky Savings Rate times the Unrewarded USDS balances in their protocol. The expectation is that the Integration Boost Partner will pass these Integration Boost Payments along to their users, thus providing USDS users with the equivalent of the Sky Savings Rate.

Integration Boost partners are part of the Integrator Program as defined in 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.1 - Integrator Program
. 

Current and onboarding Integrators are recorded in 
A.2.3.8.1.2.1.5 - Current And Onboarding Integrators
. 
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e0-b767-f56eaec04dcc
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ec-976f-eaf2ed2d0961
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e0-b767-f56eaec04dcc
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.1.1 - Unrewarded USDS Balances - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~Unrewarded USDS balances are USDS balances that are not receiving the Sky Savings Rate or USDS Token Rewards.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ec-976f-eaf2ed2d0961
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.1.2 - No Obligation To Pass Through Integration Boost Payments - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~Integration Boost partners are under no obligation to pass through any portion of Integration Boost payments to their users. Nevertheless, the expectation is that most partners will pass through Integration Boost payments to remain competitive with other protocols.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8018-a742-e390d93817de
~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.2 - Data Submission - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The documents herein specify data submission requirements related to the Integrator Program.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8075-aedf-ca0e97329482
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ba-b5c3-cc652fcb674a
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80c1-a0c7-f8c13c47822a
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80ba-b5c3-cc652fcb674a
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.2.1 - Data Verifiability Requirement - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~Integration Boost Partners must submit net deposit data in such a form that the data can be verified by Sky using on-chain data. In the short term, Ecosystem Actor BA Labs calculates the net deposit data based on on-chain events and makes it available to Operational GovOps through an API endpoint. The API endpoint is 
https://info-sky.blockanalitica.com/api/v1/incentivized-pools/
 for Integration Boost Partners on Ethereum and 
https://info-sky.blockanalitica.com/api/v1/solana-incentives/
 on Solana. In the long term, Operational GovOps assumes responsibility for ensuring that the data submission meets the on-chain verifiability requirement; this is done as part of their review of Invocations of the Integration Boost Primitive.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8075-aedf-ca0e97329482
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.2.2 - Data Submission Responsible Party - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~Integration Boost Partners must also identify a responsible party that will submit the net deposit data. In the near term, this is BA Labs. In the long term, this may be the Integration Boost Partner, a third party contractor, or the Star Agent or Operational GovOps themselves if they agree to do so.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80c1-a0c7-f8c13c47822a
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.2.3 - Data Submission Frequency - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~Data is calculated on a weekly basis from Monday to Sunday for payment the following Monday. Failure to submit data on time will result in a delay of payment of the Integration Boost until the following week.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8004-8fe0-ff163fa25192
~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.3 - Distribution - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The documents herein define base elements of the Integration Boost Primitive related to the distribution of the Integration Boost.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-800b-ac84-d37e5d12bbff
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-803c-bd96-ffd0c882b6fc
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e2-9262-c04109146b4e
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-800b-ac84-d37e5d12bbff
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.3.1 - Cadence - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Cadence is the frequency at which the Integration Boost is calculated and distributed. There are only three options available for the Reward Cadence: (1) weekly, (2) biweekly, or (3) monthly. 
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-803c-bd96-ffd0c882b6fc
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.3.2 - Treasury Management - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The documents herein define the treasury management process.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-8006-8d52-f441b4e85f5b
~~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e5-9492-cee6e21858d7
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8006-8d52-f441b4e85f5b
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.3.2.1 - Near Term Process - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~In the short term, the Support Facilitators directly pay Integration Boost recipients from Integration Boost wallets. The balance of these wallets on the Ethereum Mainnet may be topped up to 3 million USDS, although the balance of Integration Boost wallets across blockchains may exceed that amount. The funding is subject to an Executive Vote. The addresses of these wallets are:

• Ethereum (ETH) - 
0xd6891d1dffda6b0b1af3524018a1ee2e608785f7

• Solana (SOL) - 
7Gf8AqAtmYkkVhQbbJr18RxVUuoGjA8ZEw3Af4NauyaY

• Solana Hot Wallet - 
BKT2JR5wRWsXQBxrht1LbbbKtgUkz3sJdaBY8UzgRJPL
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e5-9492-cee6e21858d7
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.3.2.2 - Long Term Process - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~In the long term, Operational GovOps calculates the Integration Boost for each occurrence of the specified Cadence. Operational GovOps then pays the Integration Boost recipient from its Buffer. Later, Sky Core reimburses the Operational Agent Buffer for the amount paid as part of the Settlement Cycle. This minimizes the role of Sky Core in Integration Boost payments and emphasizes the primary role of the Operational Executor Agent, acting through Operational GovOps, in implementing the Sky Primitives. The process is specified in further detail in 
A.2.3.8.2.2.4.1 - Routine Protocol
. 
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e2-9262-c04109146b4e
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.3.3 - Payment Errors - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~If it is discovered that previous Integration Boost calculations were made erroneously, underpayments are resolved retroactively. In cases where an Integrator was overpaid, the Star Agent associated with the Integrator must reimburse Sky the overpayment amount and can use future Integration Boost payments that the Integrator earns to reimburse itself.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b9-9a79-d4760cafc9dc
~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.4 - Accessibility Rewards - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~Net USDS balances in a DeFi protocol that is receiving an Integration Boost are also eligible for the Accessibility Reward.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-808a-8716-c6275738b5fc
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b9-bfda-ea8ef1815cde
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80bc-9d0d-db77b55d06b8
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b9-bfda-ea8ef1815cde
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.4.1 - Reporting Of Net USDS Balances Is Valid Tracking Methodology - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The methodology used to report net USDS balances in the protocol for the Integration Boost is itself an acceptable Tracking Methodology for purposes of the Accessibility Reward.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80bc-9d0d-db77b55d06b8
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.4.2 - No Double Payments - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~Accessibility Reward may only be paid on net USDS balances of an Integration Boost partner to the extent that an Accessibility Reward is not already being paid on those balances.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-808a-8716-c6275738b5fc
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.1.4.3 - Star Agent May Choose Whether To Share Accesibility Reward With Integration Boost Partner - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~Star Agents may choose whether to share Accessibility Reward payments with Integration Boost Partners.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80f6-b6e2-dcc21d43f842

~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.1.1.2 - Dependencies - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~This process is dependent on a Star Agent Globally Activating the Integration Boost Primitive pursuant to 
A.2.3.8.2.2.2 - Global Activation
. 
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80c7-bd26-efd1b671e59d
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.1.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The process flow is defined herein.

• The Star Agent identifies a DeFi protocol or market where an Integration Boost would drive adoption. The Star Agent estimates the potential earnings from the Accessibility Reward associated with the incremental USDS usage versus the operational cost of funding the Sky Savings Rate payouts.

• The Star Agent and the prospective Integration Boost partner discuss (1) the proposed Integration Boost cadence and (2) whether and how the protocol operator also receives a portion of the Accessibility Reward.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8043-817d-e7af89451feb
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.1.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The required Primitive Inputs for this process are defined herein and organized in sequential stages.

• Drafting of Initial Planning Document

    ◦ Create 
Initial Planning Document

        • Updated fields
            • 
Status

                ◦ New value: set to 
Drafting

            • 
Integration Partner Name

                ◦ New Value: set to Integration Partner name
            • 
Integration Partner Reward Address

                ◦ New Value: set to Integration Partner reward address
            • 
Integration Partner Chain

                ◦ New Value: set to Integration Partner chain
            • 
Integration Boost Cadence

                ◦ New Value: set to Integration Boost cadence
            • 
Integration Boost Data Submission Format

                ◦ New Value: populate with details for format of data submission
            • 
Integration Boost Data Submission Responsible Actor

                ◦ New Value: set to Actor responsible for data submission
            • 
Integration Boost Savings Rate Adjustment Strategy

                ◦ New Value: populate with details for handling adjustments to Sky Savings Rate
            • 
Custom Instance Parameters

                ◦ New Value: populate with details for any custom parameters
        • Responsible Party: Star Agent Team
        • Trigger - Required Output: After Star Agent's 
Initial planning document
 Status is set to 
Drafting
 

• Initial Planning Document triggered for GovOps review

    ◦ Edit 
Initial Planning Document

        • Updated fields
            • 
Integration Boost Savings Rate Adjustment Strategy

                ◦ New value: updated content, as applicable
            • 
Status

                ◦ New value: set to 
Ready for GovOps Review

        • Responsible party: Star Agent
        • Trigger - Required Output: After Star Agent's 
Initial planning document
 Status is set to 
Ready for GovOps review
.

~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8069-9b30-cc2190124334
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.2.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The process flow is defined herein:

• Operational GovOps reviews the 
Initial Planning Document
 to ensure:
    ◦ The submitted data can be verified using on-chain data;
    ◦ the Savings Rate Adjustment Strategy ensures that the payment on USDS balances equals the Sky Savings Rate, and
    ◦ the submitted data accurately reflects USDS deposits in the Integration Partner protocol and there is no possibility that rewards could be “double counted” (i.e. multiple actors being paid for the same USDS balance).

• Operational GovOps submits its feedback into the 
Operational GovOps Review Document
 (created at Create 
Operational GovOps Review Document
) along with suggested changes, if any.

• The Star Agent incorporates feedback from Operational GovOps and edits its 
Initial Planning Document
 as needed.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80de-a428-e77507ce5d2f

~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The following inputs must be submitted into the Primitive using the Powerhouse interface.

• Create 
Operational GovOps Review Document

    ◦ Updated fields
        • 
Initial Planning Document

            • New Value: automatically links to respective Document
        • 
Feedback Summary

            • New Value: GovOps populates with its review commentary and suggested changes that are agreed to by Agent and GovOps, if any.
        • Responsible party: Operational GovOps.

~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.3.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The process flow is defined herein:

• The Star Agent creates the 
Artifact Edit Draft
 Document and works to finalize its draft of the Artifact Edit per discussions with Operational GovOps.

• When draft is finalized, the Star Agent triggers the creation of the 
Artifact Edit Proposal
, which inherits content from the finalized 
Artifact Edit Draft
 Document.

• The Star Agent submits the 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document to the Powerhouse system.

~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-804b-9d7f-c7323d6c7252
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.3.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~content:

• Agent creates 
Artifact Edit Draft
 document; drafting in progress

    ◦ Edit 
Artifact Edit Draft

        • Updated fields
            • Status
                ◦ New value: set to 
In Progress

            • Content
                ◦ New value: populate with drafted content

• Agent finalizes 
Artifact Edit Draft

    ◦ Edit 
Artifact Edit Draft

        • Updated fields
            • Status
                ◦ New value: set to 
Draft Finalized


• Powerhouse System Creates 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document
    ◦ Updated fields
        • Content
            • New value: Inherits data from 
Artifact Edit Draft
 Document’s Content field.
    ◦ Responsible party: Operational GovOps [if not automated]

• Agent submits 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document to Powerhouse system
    ◦ Updated fields
        • Status:
            • New value: set to  
Pending Facilitator Review

    ◦ Responsible Party: Agent

~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.4.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The process flow is defined herein.

• The Operational Facilitator reviews the 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 to ensure alignment with the Sky Core Atlas and the Agent Artifact.

• Where the Proposal is determined to be aligned, the Operational Facilitator updates the 
Artifact Edit Proposal
  Document to reflect their approval and commentary, if any.

• Where the Proposal is determined to be misaligned, the Operational Facilitator updates the 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 document to reflect their rejection and commentary. Commentary is required where the Operational Facilitator rejects the proposal for misalignment.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80b2-ab00-d96e7ee3f7e6
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.4.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The required Primitive Inputs to this process are defined herein and organized as two mutually exclusive pathways. Once the Review outcome is determined by the Facilitator, the corresponding Pathway is followed to the exclusion of the other.

• Operational Facilitator Approves Proposal
    ◦ Edit 
Artifact Edit Proposal

        • Updated fields
            • 
Operational Facilitator Review/Review Decision

                ◦ New value: set to 
Approved

            • 
Commentary

                ◦ New value (optional): populate with reasoning for Approval
            • 
Status

                ◦ New value: set to 
Proposal Approved by Facilitator
 [automated]
        • Responsible party: Operational Facilitator
        • Trigger-Process: 
A.2.3.8.2.2.3.5 - Process Definition for Offchain Vote
.
 
• Operational Facilitator Rejects Proposal
    ◦ Edit 
Artifact Edit Proposal

        • Updated fields
            • 
Operational Facilitator Review/Review Decision

                ◦ New value: set to 
Rejected

            • 
Commentary

                ◦ New value (required): populate with reasoning for Rejection
            • 
Status

                ◦ New value: set to 
Proposal Rejected By Facilitator
 [automated]
        • Responsible party: Operational Facilitator

~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-809b-b452-df36923f0a0c
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.5.1.2 - Dependencies - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~This process has no dependencies.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8017-b655-c99fc377f79b
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.5.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The process flow for this process is defined herein:

• Using the finalized 
Atlas Edit Proposal
 content, the Operational Facilitator sets up an offchain Snapshot vote.

• Star Agent token holders vote on the proposal.

• After the voting concludes, the Operational Facilitator records the result of the vote in the Powerhouse system.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80bd-afdf-d7d9eb3121b3
~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.5.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The required Primitive Inputs to this process are defined herein.

• After Facilitator prepares Snapshot vote:
    ◦ Edit 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document
        • Updated fields
            • Status
                ◦ New value: set to 
Pending Poll

            • Off-chain Snapshot
                ◦ New value: Populate with link to the official Snapshot page
        • Responsible party: Operational Facilitator

• Mutually Exclusive Input Pathways: The two Primitive Inputs below are mutually exclusive pathways. Once the vote concludes, the corresponding Pathway is followed to the exclusion of the other.

    ◦ Proposal Passes
        • Edit 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document
            • Update fields
                ◦ Status
                    • New value: set to 
Poll Approved

            • Responsible party: Operational Facilitator.
            • Trigger - Required Output: Proposal passes

    ◦ Proposal Fails
        • Updated fields
            • Edit 
Artifact Edit Proposal
 Document
                ◦ Status
                    • New value: set to 
Poll Rejected

            • Responsible party: Operational Facilitator.
            • Trigger - Required Output: Proposal fails

.

Primitive Hub Document

 is

 in Primitive Hub Document/Data Repository

~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.3.6.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The following inputs must be submitted into the Primitive using the Powerhouse interface.

• Edit 
Instance Configuration Document
 to reflect ratified Primitive Instance.
    ◦ Updated fields
        • Parameters/Status - automatically inherits from 
Primitive Hub Document

        • Parameters/Integration Partner Name
            • New Value: set to 
Integration Partner Name
 value from approved Proposal
        • Parameters/Integration Partner Reward Address
            • New Value: set to 
Integration Partner Reward Address
 value from approved Proposal
        • Parameters/Integration Partner Chain
            • New Value: set to 
Integration Partner Chain
 value from approved Proposal
        • Parameters/Integration Boost Cadence
            • New Value: set to 
Integration Boost Cadence
 value from approved Proposal
        • Parameters/Integration Boost Data Submission Format
            • New Value: set to 
Integration Boost Data Submission Formatat
 value from approved Proposal
        • Parameters/Integration Boost Data Submission Responsible Actor
            • New Value: set to 
Integration Boost Data Submission Responsible Actor
 value from approved Proposal
        • Parameters/Integration Boost Savings Rate Adjustment Strategy
            • New Value: set to 
Integration Boost Savings Rate Adjustment Strategy
 value from approved Proposal
        • Parameters/Custom Instance Parameters
            • New Value: set to 
Custom Instance Parameters
valute from approved Proposal
        •  Responsible party: Operational GovOps [if not automated]

~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.4.1.1.2 - Process Flow - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The process flow is defined herein:

• At the end of each Integration Boost period, the data provider submits the net USDS deposit data to Powerhouse.

• Operational GovOps verifies this data by checking on-chain balances and confirms that there are no discrepancies.

• Operational GovOps then calculates the payout based on the net USDS deposit data and the Sky Savings Rate.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-8041-ada7-f41758cac29f
~~~~~~~~A.2.3.8.2.2.4.1.1.3 - Required Primitive Inputs - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The required Primitive Inputs to this process are specified herein.

• Edit 
Integration Boost Payments
 Document (Active Data)
    ◦ Updated fields
        • Status
            • New value: set to 
In Progress

        • Underlying data
            • New value: populate with underlying data used to calculate the net deposits
        • Net deposits
            • New value: populate with calculated value
        • Integration Boost payment due
            • New value: populate with calculated value.
    ◦ Responsible party: Operational GovOps.
    ◦ Trigger-Process:

.
