~A.3.3 - First Loss Capital - article
~content:
~Star Agents who invest capital from Sky’s Collateral Portfolio using the Allocation System Primitive must hold First Loss Capital (”FLC”) to protect Sky from potential losses on these investments. This Article sets forth the framework governing First Loss Capital.
~hub urls:
~child ids:
~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a2-a0b8-f5f6d40a6032
~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80cf-b30f-fc1507f3fe4d
~--------------------
~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a2-a0b8-f5f6d40a6032
~~A.3.3.1 - Conceptual Framework - section
~~content:
~~This Section defines the conceptual framework for First Loss Capital.
~~hub urls:
~~child ids:
~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8081-8d25-f0ca2b967fc9
~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f7-b4a1-e61e0e2087ba
~~--------------------
~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8081-8d25-f0ca2b967fc9
~~~A.3.3.1.1 - Required Capital - core
~~~content:
~~~The documents herein define the conceptual framework for determining the amount of capital that Star Agents are required to hold to protect Sky from risks on their investments.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8019-86f1-d6e3cf60b046
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-803a-9695-c4f86f4fd509
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8091-96f6-dbeefab7bf41
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e4-915c-f68218cae1b3
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e7-95ea-eeda847b8e8a
~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e7-95ea-eeda847b8e8a
~~~~A.3.3.1.1.1 - Risk Factors - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define how First Loss Capital required for different categories of risk are calculated and combined to determine total First Loss Capital.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8036-8668-d491ac445d77
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a4-af8a-f27892bf1412
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80df-8e75-ef74fa4e54d9
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80fc-a9ed-c86ef33ff2ba
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8036-8668-d491ac445d77
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.1.1 - Introduction - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~Different risk factors may apply to varying degrees to particular types of investments. For example, investments through decentralized lending markets are subject to credit risk but not legal risk. As such, the risk framework contains methodologies for calculating the First Loss Capital required with respect to different risk factors. The First Loss Capital requirements for each risk factor relevant to an investment are then added together to arrive at the total First Loss Capital required.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80fc-a9ed-c86ef33ff2ba
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.1.2 - Process - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The documents herein provide an overview of the process for estimating First Loss Capital for different types of investments.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-800c-9292-cdd041d32fb1
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8021-9626-d010f7928505
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-809b-9ea7-daff541db600
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-809b-9ea7-daff541db600
~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.1.2.1 - Determining Relevant Risk Factors - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~For each type of investment, the relevant risk factors should be determined. This determination should be based on a fundamental analysis of the extent to which each of these risk factors is relevant to the investment.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-800c-9292-cdd041d32fb1
~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.1.2.2 - Estimating Risk Factors - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~For each risk factor that is relevant to an investment, the required First Loss Capital to protect Sky from potential losses on that investment should be estimated.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8021-9626-d010f7928505
~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.1.2.3 - Calculating Aggregate First Loss Capital - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~Once the First Loss Capital requirements associated with each risk factor are calculated, they should be added to arrive at a total First Loss Capital requirement.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80df-8e75-ef74fa4e54d9
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.1.3 - Application To Lending Markets - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The near term focus of the framework is on lending markets such as SparkLend. For lending markets, the relevant risk factors are financial risk, smart contract risk, and admin risk.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a4-af8a-f27892bf1412
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.1.4 - Incorporation Of Additional Risk Factors - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~Additional risk factors, including legal risk and oracle risk, will be incorporated in future iterations of the risk framework.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-803a-9695-c4f86f4fd509
~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2 - Financial Risk - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define the conceptual framework for determining the First Loss Capital required to protect Sky from financial risk arising from investments by Star Agents of funds from Sky’s Collateral Portfolio. The financial risk framework is currently focused on credit risk. In future iterations of the risk framework, financial risk will be disaggregated into credit risk, liquidity risk, and market risk.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-801f-9ea4-ca2559d25de8
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8020-be56-e15ca35f6cfa
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c7-a35f-ecab2193e344
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8020-be56-e15ca35f6cfa
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.1 - Credit Risk - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~Credit risk is the risk that a loan or other debt instrument will not be repaid according to agreed terms.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c7-a35f-ecab2193e344
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.2 - Exposure And Rehypothecation - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~In lending markets, an asset originally posted as collateral may be subsequently lent as collateral for additional loans, increasing overall exposure. Methodologies for estimating risk should take into account this overall exposure. To the extent that other investments have similar mechanisms that can increase overall risk, these should be incorporated into the calculation of First Loss Capital.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8000-baaa-f78b4a291151
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-806b-9ff6-f329f72b6577
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8000-baaa-f78b4a291151
~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.2.1 - Depth Levels - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~To capture exposures related to rehypothecation, the First Loss Capital framework utilizes the concept of “depth levels”. The first depth level relates to exposures that have not been rehypothecated. The second depth level relates to additional exposures from the rehypothecated portion of first depth level exposures. The possibility of further lending from re-lent positions should be accounted for, either as an adjustment to the second depth level exposure or through incorporation of additional depth levels.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-806b-9ff6-f329f72b6577
~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.2.2 - Tracking Effective Exposures - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~Effective exposures should reflect both non-rehypothecated exposures from the first depth level as well as rehypotheca
ted exposures from the second depth level.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-801f-9ea4-ca2559d25de8
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.3 - Core Metrics - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The documents herein define core metrics that will be used in the Financial Risk framework.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b6-a9f1-f373d866c76e
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80eb-9e5f-c1b0dd5804a8
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80ed-9d16-dc2d2fa65fac
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80fc-a300-d9265d71d6f2
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80eb-9e5f-c1b0dd5804a8
~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.3.1 - Probability Of Default - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The Probability Of Default is the probability that a loan will def
ault. This is an important variable in determining First Loss Capital required for Credit Risk.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a1-8411-f123787e1cab
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a1-8411-f123787e1cab
~~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.3.1.1 - Current Limitations - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Probability Of Default is currently estimated assuming that returns of the underlying asset are normally distributed. Future iterations of the risks framework should explore other probability distributions to better incorporate “fat tails” in asset returns.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80ed-9d16-dc2d2fa65fac
~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.3.2 - Loss Given Default - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The Loss Given Default is the estimate of the loss that will occur on a loan conditional on it having defaulted. It is typically estimated at some confidence level, for example that in 99.9% of cases, the actual loss will not exceed the specified value. This is an important variable in determining First Loss Capital Required for Credit Risk.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8092-9626-e71039398973
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8092-9626-e71039398973
~~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.3.2.1 - Current Limitations - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The Loss Given Default is currently estimated assuming that returns of the underlying asset are normally distributed. Future iterations of the risk framework should explore other probability distributions to better incorporate “fat tails” in asset returns.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80fc-a300-d9265d71d6f2
~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.3.3 - Asset Correlation - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~Asset Correlation is a factor that accounts for the fact that defaults on loans are not completely correlated, so some loans in a portfolio may default while others continue to perform.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8069-85f8-f36e8bbabb4e
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8069-85f8-f36e8bbabb4e
~~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.3.3.1 - Current Limitations - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The current implementation of Asset Correlation uses parameters from the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision that were estimated for commercial loans. (
https://www.bis.org/bcbs/irbriskweight.pdf
). These should be replaced by parameters that are based on historical correlation of crypto loans in a future iteration of the risk framework.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b6-a9f1-f373d866c76e
~~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.2.3.4 - First Loss Capital - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The First Loss Capital required for Credit Risk is a function of the Probability of Default, the Loss Given Default, and the Asset Correlation. The methodology for calculating First Loss Capital required for Credit Risk based on these variables is specified in the implementation of the First Loss Capital framework.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8091-96f6-dbeefab7bf41
~~~~A.3.3.1.1.3 - Smart Contract Risk - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define the conceptual framework for determining the First Loss Capital required to protect Sky from smart contract risk arising from investments by Star Agents of funds from Sky’s Collateral Portfolio.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8044-acb6-fba37c5bdc45
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-806d-9c70-fde36a63fd66
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-808e-8593-d632b6145bdd
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-806d-9c70-fde36a63fd66
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.3.1 - Definition - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~Smart Contract Risk refers to the risk that an investment through the Allocation System will experience a loss of funds due to a bug or technical exploit. This risk may arise from the protocol invested in or other aspects of the investment such as bridging requirements.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-808e-8593-d632b6145bdd
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.3.2 - Development - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The conceptual framework for smart contract risk is still being developed, so Star Agents are not currently required to hold any First Loss Capital for Smart Contract Risk; they are only required to hold First Loss Capital for Credit Risk. 
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8044-acb6-fba37c5bdc45
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.3.3 - Short Term Review By Operational GovOps - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~Until the framework for Smart Contract Risk has been implemented, Operational Executor Agents can decline to operationalize any Allocation System Primitive deployment that they deem poses excessive smart contract risk, unless the Agent maintains 100% First Loss Capital for that deployment.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8019-86f1-d6e3cf60b046
~~~~A.3.3.1.1.4 - Admin Risk - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define the conceptual framework for determining the First Loss Capital required to protect Sky from admin risk arising from investments by Star Agents of funds from Sky’s Collateral Portfolio.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-800b-91f2-e1cc863075d1
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8028-9b0c-c5c01aa34f43
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f2-a4fa-cef7d8470f29
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8028-9b0c-c5c01aa34f43
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.4.1 - Definition - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~Admin Risk refers to the risk that an investment through the Allocation System will experience a loss of funds due to abuse of privileged access to a protocol. This risk may arise from a multisig or another actor that has the ability to modify the protocol or access funds without going through a governance process.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f2-a4fa-cef7d8470f29
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.4.2 - Development - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The conceptual framework for admin risk is still being developed, so Star Agents are not currently required to hold any First Loss Capital for Admin Risk; they are only required to hold First Loss Capital for Credit Risk.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-800b-91f2-e1cc863075d1
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.4.3 - Short Term Review By Operational GovOps - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~Until the framework for Admin Risk has been implemented, Operational Executor Agents can decline to operationalize any Allocation System Primitive deployment that they deem poses excessive admin risk, unless the Agent maintains 100% First Loss Capital for that deployment.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e4-915c-f68218cae1b3
~~~~A.3.3.1.1.5 - Near-Term Framework Scope - core
~~~~content:
~~~~In the near term, the First Loss Capital framework applies only to capital deployments into lending markets such as SparkLend. The framework will be expanded to cover additional asset classes over time.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-804d-8df9-f5b7ef6ac9f4
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b6-9987-dec480713242
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b6-9987-dec480713242
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.5.1 - Other Exposures - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The documents herein specify the near term logic regarding First Loss Capital requirements for types of assets other than lending markets.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-804d-8df9-f5b7ef6ac9f4
~~~~~A.3.3.1.1.5.2 - Restricted Exposures - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The documents herein define types of exposures that are either restricted or completely prohibited until the conceptual framework and its implementation are expanded to include them.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f7-b4a1-e61e0e2087ba
~~~A.3.3.1.2 - Eligible Assets - core
~~~content:
~~~The documents herein define the conceptual framework for eligible assets that Star Agents may hold that count toward their required First Loss Capital. Agents failing to maintain the required level of capital will be subject to penalties.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8095-b29a-cedba01b1d94
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8099-87b9-e2a6abf6fc67
~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8095-b29a-cedba01b1d94
~~~~A.3.3.1.2.1 - Location Of Eligible Assets - core
~~~~content:
~~~~To count toward a Star Agent’s required First Loss Capital, assets must be held in the Star Agent’s SubProxy account or another account that is controlled by the Star Agent’s Operational Executor Agent.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8099-87b9-e2a6abf6fc67
~~~~A.3.3.1.2.2 - Types Of Eligible Assets - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define the types of assets that count toward a Star Agent’s required First Loss Capital.

• These types of assets will be specified in a future iteration of the Risk Framework.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:

~~A.3.3.2 - Implementation - section
~~content:
~~This Section defines the current implementation of the First Loss Capital framework.

~~~A.3.3.2.1 - Financial Risk Implementation - core
~~~content:
~~~The documents herein define the implementation of the financial risk framework.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-803f-afd7-ff6188d8a0ae
~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-803f-afd7-ff6188d8a0ae
~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1 - Asset Class Specific Implementation - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define implementations of the financial risk framework for specific asset classes. In the near term, the only implementation that is defined is for lending markets. In the future additional implementations will be added herein.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80bc-92a0-edaf3c217a6d
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80bc-92a0-edaf3c217a6d
~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1 - Lending Markets - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The documents herein define the implementation of the financial risk framework for lending markets.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f0-a03e-df7b2dbe7c40
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f0-a03e-df7b2dbe7c40
~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1 - Calculation - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~The documents herein define the calculation of the First Loss Capital with respect to a Star Agent’s investments. Unless otherwise specified, code is in Python. Alternative implementations may be used but these implementations must produce the same outputs as the reference implementation included herein.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8022-9ad9-c02c45826d76
~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-802d-a790-e4ae02e0a977
~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8036-8719-d6565bbeaae0
~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8064-8f17-ffaae00ec68f
~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a7-811b-cecc9e522384
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a7-811b-cecc9e522384
~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1 - Variables - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The documents herein define the variables that are used in the calculation of First Loss Capital.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8067-bac9-ef7f7e26f7de
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8084-a88a-e897d82930dc
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8097-99af-d18ceec31977
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8097-99af-d18ceec31977
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.1 - Methodology - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~All floating point variables are specified to four decimal places of precision. For example, 100 million would be represented as 
100000000.0000
 and 75% would be represented as 
0.7500
.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8067-bac9-ef7f7e26f7de
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.2 - Input Variables - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~Input variables are variables that are input into the model for calculating First Loss Capital, either based on on-chain or off-chain data or reflecting assumptions or parameters set by Governance.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-802c-9706-d75e12ae7adb
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8030-93c4-db7ee2fe11d1
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-804f-be31-cc28a82e51ed
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8054-b2ea-fcf4e3b8ba19
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8082-8b17-caeae533b78a
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8099-97e1-e23c1ff04ee2
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80eb-928b-e8b872e9e81f
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f3-b47c-d1a51cd62b87
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f5-92d7-ddfad281fe03
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8030-93c4-db7ee2fe11d1
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.2.1 - Underlying Market - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
underlying
 variable is a string identifying the asset borrowed in a particular lending market. For example, if DAI is borrowed in a lending market, then the value of the 
underlying
 for that market would be 
DAI
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80eb-928b-e8b872e9e81f
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.2.2 - Collateral Name - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
collateral_name
 variable is a string identifying a particular collateral asset. For example, if WETH is used as collateral, then the value of the 
collateral_name
 for that collateral would be 
WETH
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8054-b2ea-fcf4e3b8ba19
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.2.3 - Debt Backed - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
debt_backed
 variable is a floating point number indicating the amount of the underlying asset borrowed in a market backed by a particular collateral. It is calculated by multiplying (1) the dollar amount of the underlying asset borrowed by (2) the ratio of the dollar value of the collateral to the dollar value of all collaterals across all markets. For example, if there are $30 million of DAI borrowings and $70 million of USDC borrowings that are collectively backed by $240 million of WETH and $60 million of WBTC, then 
debt_backed
 for the DAI market and the WETH collateral would be $24 million.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f5-92d7-ddfad281fe03
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.2.4 - Collateral - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
collateral
 variable is a floating point number indicating the amount of a particular collateral for a market. It is calculated by multiplying (1) the dollar amount of the collateral by (2) the ratio of dollar borrowings in the market to the dollar value of borrowings across all markets. For example, if there are $30 million of DAI borrowings and $70 million of USDC borrowings that are collectively backed by $240 million of WETH and $60 million of WBTC, then 
collateral
 for the DAI market and the WETH collateral would be $72 million.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-802c-9706-d75e12ae7adb
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.2.5 - Liquidation Threshold - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
liquidation_threshold
 is a floating point number indicating the loan to value point at which liquidation is triggered in a lending market.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f3-b47c-d1a51cd62b87
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.2.6 - Liquidation Penalty - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
liquidation_penalty
 is a floating point number representing the percentage of the amount liquidated that is paid to the actor that liquidates an unhealthy loan in a lending market.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8082-8b17-caeae533b78a
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.2.7 - Liquidation Efficiency Factor - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
liquidation_efficiency_factor
 is an estimate of what percent of the fair market value of the collateral can be recovered in liquidation. The 
liquidation_efficiency_factor
 is currently set to 75% for all collaterals.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8099-97e1-e23c1ff04ee2
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.2.8 - Volatility - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
volatility
 for a collateral is a floating point number defined as the standard deviation of daily price changes for the collateral over the last 30 days.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-804f-be31-cc28a82e51ed
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.2.9 - Time Horizon - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
T
 variable is a floating point number indicating the time horizon, in years, over which the Probability Of Default is being estimated. 
T
 is currently set to one (1) year.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8084-a88a-e897d82930dc
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.3 - Derived Variables - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~Derived variables are variables that are calculated based on other variables.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8015-83a7-d50054174466
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8042-9f5e-dd04cf634e15
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8049-979e-d1ef438462e0
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e2-b8bd-de3c7ca595fb
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8049-979e-d1ef438462e0
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.3.1 - Liquidation Ratio - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
liquidation_ratio
 is the value of the collateral for a loan as a percentage of the amount borrowed below which liquidation will be triggered. It is the inverse of the 
liquidation_threshold
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8042-9f5e-dd04cf634e15
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.3.2 - Rehypothecation Factor - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
rehypothecation_factor
 is ratio of total borrowing and total collateral for an asset. Total borrowing for an asset is defined as the sum of 
debt_backed
 where that asset is the 
underlying
 for all values of 
collateral_name
. The total collateral is defined as the sum of the 
collateral
 variable where the 
collateral_name
 corresponds to the asset across all values of 
underlying
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e2-b8bd-de3c7ca595fb
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.3.3 - Relative Debt Backed - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
relative_debt_backed
 for an 
underlying
 and a 
collateral_name
 is the 
debt_backed
 for that 
underlying
 and 
collateral_name
 divided by the sum of the 
debt_backed
 for all 
collateral_name
 values for the 
underlying
. For example, if there are $100 million of DAI borrowings, of which $80 million are backed by WETH and $20 million are backed by WBTC, the 
relative_debt_backed
 for the DAI market and the WETH collateral would be 80%.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8015-83a7-d50054174466
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.1.3.4 - Relative Collateral - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The 
relative_collateral
 is the 
collateral
 for a particular 
underlying
 and 
collateral_name
 divided by the sum of the values for all 
collateral
 for that 
underlying
. For example, if $100 million of DAI borrowings are backed by $300 million of WETH and $100 million of WBTC, the value of the 
relative_collateral
 for WETH would be 75%.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8036-8719-d6565bbeaae0
~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2 - Calculating Effective Exposures - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The first stage of the calculation process is calculating effective exposures for each asset, including both first order exposures and second order exposures from rehypothecation.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8000-868a-fced37a4d89d
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-806f-a2b5-d904842ce686
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-808d-8912-c27e5f0773cb
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8093-804f-cba73c7f44fa
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b3-a2d6-d3357ce64b8d
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b7-a8e8-ffcb01fba2fe
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8000-868a-fced37a4d89d
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.1 - Initial Data - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The process begins with a single table where each row corresponds to a single combination of asset being borrowed ( 
underlying
 ) and backing collateral (
collateral_name
 ). Each row has the following fields:

• 
underlying

• 
collateral_name

• 
debt_backed

• 
rehypothecation_factor

• 
collateral

• 
relative_debt_backed

• 
relative_collateral
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b7-a8e8-ffcb01fba2fe
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.2 - First Level Computation - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein define the First Level Computation of exposures, which breaks down exposures into non-rehypothecated and rehypothecated exposures.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-801a-8b77-f91017e5b567
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-801f-9b74-df5839992797
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8039-a959-dc8833ef5274
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-804c-a283-ccb9ef72eb55
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a4-8303-f1a86a0e9ea1
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c5-9156-d0b1c89050da
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c5-9ce9-e93759d4c03f
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f7-88df-cc7c34136c7f
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8039-a959-dc8833ef5274
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.2.1 - Methodology - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The calculations specified in the documents below should be performed for each combination of asset being borrowed (
underlying
) and backing collateral (
collateral_name
). The current value of the 
collateral_name
 for each calculation is referred to as 
collateral_1
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c5-9156-d0b1c89050da
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.2.2 - Calculation Of Level 1 Rehypothecation Factor - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Level 1 Rehypothecation Factor (
reh_factor_1
) is set equal to the 
rehypothecation_factor
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-801f-9b74-df5839992797
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.2.3 - Calculation Of Level 1 Collateralization - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Level 1 Collateralization (
coll_1
) is set equal to the 
collateralization
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-801a-8b77-f91017e5b567
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.2.4 - Calculation Of Base Exposure - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Level 1 Base Exposure (
base_exposure_1
) is calculated as the 
debt_backed
 times one minus 
reh_factor_1
. This represents the portion of the exposure that is not rehypothecated.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c5-9ce9-e93759d4c03f
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.2.5 - Calculation Of Level 1 Rehypothecated Exposure - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Level 1 Rehypothecated Exposure (
reh_exposure_1
) is calculated as the 
debt_backed
 times 
reh_factor_1
. This represents the portion of the exposure that is rehypothecated.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-804c-a283-ccb9ef72eb55
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.2.6 - Calculation Of Effective Exposure - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Effective Exposure for the collateral (
effective_exposures[collateral_1]
) is set equal to 
base_exposure_1
. This will later be increased as part of the Second Level Computation.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f7-88df-cc7c34136c7f
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.2.7 - Calculation Of Debt Backed Exposure - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Debt Backed Exposure for the collateral (
debt_backed_exposures[collateral_1]
) is set equal to 
debt_backed
. This will later be increased as part of the Second Level Computation.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a4-8303-f1a86a0e9ea1
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.2.8 - Calculation Of Collateralization - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Collateralization for the collateral (
collateralization[collateral_1]
) is set equal to 
collateral
. This will later be increased as part of the Second Level Computation.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-808d-8912-c27e5f0773cb
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.3 - Second Level Computation - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein define the Second Level Computation of exposures, which calculates additional exposures due to rehypothecation.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-803a-a14f-f7f186378d53
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8069-a40c-f5c0a281efaa
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8077-99d4-dc38f0373af1
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-807c-a7e6-d9c14319328f
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a5-95af-ea5db9da4cbe
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a7-8e57-ff830ad2357d
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b2-8776-cd187dd9e570
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c5-aa07-f113fc3fc4bd
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80d9-bf3c-d94ec5258793
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a5-95af-ea5db9da4cbe
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.3.1 - Methodology - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The calculations specified in the documents below should be performed for each asset being borrowed 
underlying
 and backing collateral 
collateral_name
. The current value of the 
collateral_name
 for each calculation is referred to as 
collateral_1
. For each combination of 
underlying
 and 
collateral_name
, the calculation should be performed for each row where the 
underlying
 is equal to 
collateral_1
. The 
collateral_name
 in such row is referred to as 
collateral_2
. This considers the hypothecation exposures where an asset that is collateral is also being borrowed.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c5-aa07-f113fc3fc4bd
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.3.2 - Calculation Of Level 2 Relative Backing - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Level 2 Relative Backing (
relvative_backing_2
) is set to the 
relative_backing
 for 
underlying
 and 
collateral_2
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-803a-a14f-f7f186378d53
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.3.3 - Calculation Of Level 2 Collateralization Factor - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Level 2 Collateralization Factor (
coll_factor_2
) is set to the 
relative_collateral
 for 
underlying
 and 
collateral_2
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8077-99d4-dc38f0373af1
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.3.4 - Calculation Of Level 2 Effective Exposure - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Level 2 Effective Exposure (
effective_exposure_2
) is calculated as the product of the Level 1 Rehypothecated Exposure (
reh_exposure_1
) and the Level 2 Relative Backing, (
relative_backing_2
), scaled up by one plus the Level 1 Rehypothecation Factor (
reh_factor_1
).
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b2-8776-cd187dd9e570
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.3.5 - Calculation Of Level 2 Debt Backed - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Level 2 Debt Backed (
debt_backed_2
) is calculated as the product of the Level 1 Rehypothecated Exposure (
reh_exposure_1
) and the Level 2 Relative Backing (
relative_backing_2
).
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8069-a40c-f5c0a281efaa
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.3.6 - Calculation Of Level 2 Collateralization - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Level 2 Collateralization (
coll_backed_2
) is calculated as the product of the Level 1 Collateral, 
coll_1
 and the Level 2 Collateralization Factor, 
coll_factor_2
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-807c-a7e6-d9c14319328f
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.3.7 - Update Of Effective Exposure - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Effective Exposure for 
collateral_2
 (
effective_exposures[collateral_2]
) is incremented by 
effective_exposure_2
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80d9-bf3c-d94ec5258793
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.3.8 - Update Of Debt Backed Exposure - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Debt Backed Exposure for 
collateral_2 
(
debt_backed_exposures[collateral_2]
) is incremented by 
debt_backed_2
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a7-8e57-ff830ad2357d
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.3.9 - Update Of Collateralization - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Collateralization for the 
collateral_2 
(
collateralization[collateral_2]
) is incremented by 
coll_backed_2
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b3-a2d6-d3357ce64b8d
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.4 - Aggregation - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein define the process for aggregating the results from the First Level Computation and Second Level Computation and structuring them for use in later calculations.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-806f-9f30-ee560ddda69e
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80dd-a6a7-e376f3865a9a
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e6-b234-c3779a56955c
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e6-b234-c3779a56955c
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.4.1 - Collect Outputs From First Level Computation And Second Level Computation - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The final values of 
effective_exposures
, 
debt_backed_exposures
, and 
collateralization
 are collected into a new table with one row for each combination of 
underlying
 and 
collateral_name
.  The fields corresponding to 
effective_exposures
, 
debt_backed_exposures
, and 
collateralization
 are renamed 
effective_exposure
, 
debt_backed
, and 
effective_coll
, respectively. 
underlying
 and 
collateral_name
 are renamed 
underlying_symbol
 and 
final_collateral
, respectively.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80dd-a6a7-e376f3865a9a
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.4.2 - Attach Additional Information - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The table created above is enriched with the 
liquidation_ratio
, 
liquidation_penalty
, 
rehypothecation_factor
, and 
volatility
 variables.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-806f-9f30-ee560ddda69e
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.4.3 - Recalculate Relative Backing - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~A new renormalized 
relative_backing
 field is calculated by dividing the 
effective_exposure
 value for each row by the total 
effective_exposure
 value for all rows with the same 
underlying
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-806f-a2b5-d904842ce686
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.5 - Final Data - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~As a result of the calculations the final output of this step is a table with one row for each combination of asset being borrowed (
underlying_symbol
) and backing collateral (
final_collateral
). Each row has the following fields:

• 
underlying_symbol

• 
final_collateral

• 
effective_exposure

• 
debt_backed

• 
effective_coll

• 
liquidation_ratio

• 
liquidation_penalty

• 
rehypothecation_factor

• 
relative_backing

• 
volatility
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8093-804f-cba73c7f44fa
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.2.6 - Python Implementation - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~An implementation of the calculation of effective exposures in Python is shown below:


for underlying in all_underlyings:
    level1 = df[df['underlying_symbol'] == underlying].copy()

    # Dictionaries to accumulate exposures by collateral.
    effective_exposures = {}
    debt_backed_exposures = {}
    collateralization = {}
    
   for _, row1 in level1.iterrows():
        collateral_1  = row1['collateral_name']
        debt_1        = row1['debt_backed']
        reh_factor_1  = row1['rehypothecation_factor']
        coll_1        = row1['collateral']

        # (A) Non-rehypothecated
        base_exposure_1 = debt_1 * (1.0 - reh_factor_1)
        effective_exposures[collateral_1] = effective_exposures.get(collateral_1, 0.0) + base_exposure_1
        debt_backed_exposures[collateral_1] = debt_backed_exposures.get(collateral_1, 0.0) + debt_1
        collateralization[collateral_1] = collateralization.get(collateral_1, 0.0) + coll_1

        # (B) Rehypothecated
        reh_exposure_1 = debt_1 * reh_factor_1
        # fraction of the "coll_1" that is also being re-lent
        collateralization_1 = coll_1 * reh_factor_1
        
        level2 = df[df['underlying_symbol'] == collateral_1]
        for _, row2 in level2.iterrows():
            collateral_2 = row2['collateral_name']
            relative_backing2 = row2['relative_debt_backed']
            coll_factor2 = row2['relative_collateral']

            # Depth=2 effective exposure
            effective_exposure_2 = reh_exposure_1 * relative_backing2 * (1.0 + reh_factor_1)
            effective_exposures[collateral_2] = (
                effective_exposures.get(collateral_2, 0.0) + effective_exposure_2
            )

            # Depth=2 debt backed
            debt_backed_2 = reh_exposure_1 * relative_backing2
            debt_backed_exposures[collateral_2] = (
                debt_backed_exposures.get(collateral_2, 0.0) + debt_backed_2
            )

            # Depth=2 collateralization
            coll_backed_1 = collateralization_1 * coll_factor2
            collateralization[collateral_2] = (
                collateralization.get(collateral_2, 0.0) + coll_backed_1
            )
            
   # Combine keys from our three dictionaries:
    all_collaterals = set(effective_exposures.keys()) | set(debt_backed_exposures.keys())

    for coll_name in all_collaterals:
        res = {
            'underlying_symbol': underlying,
            'final_collateral': coll_name,
            'effective_exposure': effective_exposures.get(coll_name, 0.0),
            'debt_backed': debt_backed_exposures.get(coll_name, 0.0),
            'effective_coll': collateralization.get(coll_name, 0.0)
        }

        results.append(res)
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8064-8f17-ffaae00ec68f
~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.3 - Calculating Other Effective Parameters - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The second stage of the calculation process involves calculating other effective parameters taking into account the impact of rehypothecation.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-808f-89a7-f58347c505a8
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8095-956a-e4a00587b908
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f5-b403-e6ffce42bfce
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80fd-aa5e-d3cd18f49f1c
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80f5-b403-e6ffce42bfce
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.3.1 - Methodology - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents below define the process for calculating other effective parameters for a single row of the output table from the previous step, corresponding to a combination of an underlying market (
underlying_symbol
) and collateral (
final_collateral
).
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-808f-89a7-f58347c505a8
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.3.2 - Effective Volatility - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein define the process for computing the Effective Volatility.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a6-a470-e82e6f353ae0
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a6-a470-e82e6f353ae0
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.3.2.1 - Effective Volatility Calculation - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Effective Volatility (
effective_volatility
) is calculated for each combination of underlying market and backing collateral using the Python function specified below, where 
row
 is one row from the output table from calculating effective exposures and 
df
 is the entire table. This combines the volatility for the non-rehypothecated portion of the collateral with the volatility from the rehypothecated portion of the collateral, based on the volatility of the collaterals that back the rehypothecated portion.


def calc_effective_volatility(row, df):
    """
    Compute effective volatility.
    """
    w_top = row['relative_backing']           # The fraction of the total backing contributed by this collateral at the top level
    f_top = row['rehypothecation_factor']     # How much of this collateral is rehypothecated
    top_vol = row['volatility']               # The top-level collateral's own volatility
    
    # Non-rehypothecated portion
    non_reh_vol = (1 - f_top) * top_vol
    
    # 'M_top' is the magnitude of the portion that is rehypothecated
    M_top = w_top * f_top

    # Find "child" rows where this row's final_collateral is itself an underlying_symbol
    backing = df[df['underlying_symbol'] == row['final_collateral']].copy()
    if backing.empty:
        # If there are no deeper levels for this collateral, the effective volatility is just the top-level's volatility
        return top_vol

    # For each child, define an effective weight (w_eff) = (M_top * [child's relative_backing * child's rehypothecation_factor])
    backing['w_eff'] = M_top * (backing['relative_backing'] * backing['rehypothecation_factor'])
    
    # We model the 'combined' volatility by summing variances from each child, i.e. w_eff^2 * volatility^2
    backing['var_contrib'] = (backing['w_eff'] ** 2) * (backing['volatility'] ** 2)
    sigma_backing = np.sqrt(backing['var_contrib'].sum())
    
    # Final effective volatility = sum of top's non_rehypothecated portion + child-level sqrt of variance
    return sigma_backing + non_reh_vol

~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8095-956a-e4a00587b908
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.3.3 - Effective Liquidation Ratio - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein define the process for computing the Effective Liquidation Ratio.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8001-bbc9-c7389235ee96
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8001-bbc9-c7389235ee96
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.3.3.1 - Effective Liquidation Ratio Calculation - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Effective Liquidation Ratio (
effective_liquidation_ratio
) is calculated for each combination of underlying market and backing collateral using the Python function specified below, where 
row
 is one row from the output table from calculating effective exposures and 
df
 is the entire table. This combines the liquidation ratio for the non-rehypothecated portion of the collateral with the liquidation ratio for the rehypothecated portion of the collateral, based on the liquidation ratio of the collaterals that back the rehypothecated portion.


def calc_effective_liquidation_ratio(row, df):
    """
    Compute the effective liquidation ratio.
    """
    w_top = row['relative_backing']
    f_top = row['rehypothecation_factor']
    top_liq = row['liquidation_ratio']
    
    # Non-rehypothecated portion (straight percentage of top-level ratio)
    non_reh_liq = (1 - f_top) * top_liq
    M_top = w_top * f_top
    
    # Locate child rows
    backing = df[df['underlying_symbol'] == row['final_collateral']].copy()
    if backing.empty:
        return top_liq

    # Weighted portion for child rows
    backing['w_eff'] = M_top * (backing['relative_backing'] * backing['rehypothecation_factor'])
    liq_contrib = (backing['w_eff'] * backing['liquidation_ratio']).sum()
    
    return non_reh_liq + liq_contrib
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80fd-aa5e-d3cd18f49f1c
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.3.4 - Effective Liquidation Penalty - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein define the process for computing the Effective Liquidation Penalty.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e3-bd81-d051b911f9e4
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80e3-bd81-d051b911f9e4
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.3.4.1 - Effective Liquidation Penalty Calculation - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Effective Liquidation Penalty (
effective_liquidation_penalty
) is calculated for each combination of underlying market and backing collateral using the Python function specified below, where 
row
 is one row from the output table from calculating effective exposures and 
df
 is the entire table. This combines the liquidation penalty for the non-rehypothecated portion of the collateral with the liquidation penalty for the rehypothecated portion of the collateral, based on the liquidation penalty for the collaterals that back the rehypothecated portion.


def calc_effective_liquidation_penalty(row, df):
    """
    Compute the effective liquidation penalty.
    """
    w_top = row['relative_backing']
    f_top = row['rehypothecation_factor']
    top_pen = row['liquidation_penalty']
    
    non_reh_pen = (1 - f_top) * top_pen
    M_top = w_top * f_top
    
    backing = df[df['underlying_symbol'] == row['final_collateral']].copy()
    if backing.empty:
        return top_pen

    backing['w_eff'] = M_top * (backing['relative_backing'] * backing['rehypothecation_factor'])
    pen_contrib = (backing['w_eff'] * backing['liquidation_penalty']).sum()
    
    return non_reh_pen + pen_contrib
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8022-9ad9-c02c45826d76
~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4 - Calculating First Loss Capital - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The third stage is calculating the actual First Loss Capital required based on the previously calculated variables.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8035-9345-e23a60f89e29
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-803b-9417-df0f9dbbc934
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-803d-b798-d5396bdae3ac
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8071-9fb6-d9f148b4d9d0
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-808c-9433-e3ff37e35fc7
~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b2-9382-f4808126c2e3
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-803b-9417-df0f9dbbc934
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.1 - Probability Of Default - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein specify the process for calculating the Probability Of Default.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8074-b905-eef4595be926
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8074-b905-eef4595be926
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.1.1 - Calculation Of Probability Of Default - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The probability of default (
PD
 ) is calculated based on the 
effective_liquidation_ratio
, the 
effective_collateralization_ratio
, the 
effective_volatility
, and 
T
 using the Python code specified below, which assumes that returns for the collateral are normally distributed.


PD = norm.cdf(ln(effective_liquidation_ratio / effective_collateralization_ratio)
                / (effective_volatility * sqrt(T)))


Here 
norm.cdf
 is the cumulative distribution function of the standard normal distribution.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-803d-b798-d5396bdae3ac
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.2 - Loss Given Default - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein specify the process for calculating the Loss Given Default.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8058-bdc9-c819e42e36a5
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8076-a5e1-e4338004a263
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80ea-9711-d60a3b7b6396
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8076-a5e1-e4338004a263
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.2.1 - Calculation Of Recovery Rate - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~For each underlying market and backing collateral, a Recovery Rate is first calculated. This is equal to the product of (1) the Debt Backed (
debt_backed
), (2) one minus the Effective Liquidation Penalty (
effective_liquidation_penaly
), and (3) the Liquidation Efficiency Factor (
liquidation_efficiency_factor
), divided by the Effective Exposure 
effective_exposure
.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80ea-9711-d60a3b7b6396
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.2.2 - Calculation Of Loss Given Default - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~For each underlying market and backing collateral, the Loss Given Default (
LGD
) is then calculated as one minus the Recovery Rate, with the stipulation that the Loss Given Default cannot be less than zero.
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8058-bdc9-c819e42e36a5
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.2.3 - Python Implementation - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~An implementation of the calculation of the Loss Given Default in Python is shown below:


LGD = max(
    1 - (
        debt_backed
        * effective_liquidation_ratio
        * (1 - effective_liquidation_penalty)
        * liquidation_efficiency_factor
        / effective_exposure
    ),
    0
)
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8071-9fb6-d9f148b4d9d0
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.3 - Asset Correlation Coefficient - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein specify the process for calculating the Asset Correlation Coefficient.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-800d-8a64-c0cf9710212d
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-800d-8a64-c0cf9710212d
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.3.1 - Asset Correlation Coefficient Calculation - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Asset Correlation Coefficient (
ACC
) for each underlying market and collateral is calculated using the formula specified in the Python code below as a function of the Probability Of Default (
PD
).


X   = (1 - exp(-50 * PD)) / (1 - exp(-50))
ACC = 0.12 * X + 0.24 * (1 - X)
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b2-9382-f4808126c2e3
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.4 - Credit Risk - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein specify the process for calculating Credit Risk.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8046-8102-d80e0f18e421
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8096-b814-cb389bbacbe4
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8096-b814-cb389bbacbe4
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.4.1 - Calculation Of Shifted Probability Of Default - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Shifted Probability Of Default (
shifted_PD
) for an underlying market and collateral is calculated as a function of the Probability Of Default (
PD
) and the Asset Correlation Coefficient (
ACC
) using the Python code below. This estimates the probability of default under a “stressed” scenario.


shifted_PD = norm.cdf(
    ( norm.ppf(PD) + sqrt(ACC) * norm.ppf(0.999) )
    / sqrt(1 - ACC)
)
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8046-8102-d80e0f18e421
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.4.2 - Calculation Of Credit Risk - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Credit Risk (
credit_risk
) for an underlying market and collateral is calculated as the difference between the Shifted Probability Of Default (
shifted_PD
) and the Probability Of Default (
PD
), multiplied by the Loss Given Default (
LGD
). This is shown in the Python code below.


credit_risk = (shifted_PD - PD) * LGD
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-808c-9433-e3ff37e35fc7
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.5 - Risk Weighted Assets - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~The documents herein specify the process for calculating Risk Weighted Assets.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8019-9c74-c5c84c15d355
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-804b-bab8-fa8216cfa71d
~~~~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8086-a6b3-d20644ab3e77
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8019-9c74-c5c84c15d355
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.5.1 - Calculation Of Weighted Credit Risk - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Weighted Credit Risk (
weighted_credit_risk(u)
) for each underlying market (
u
) is calculated as the sum of the product of the Relative Backing (
relative_backing(i)
) and the Credit Risk (
credit_risk(i)
) for each collateral (
i
) backing that market.


weighted_credit_risk(u) = sum(relative_backing(i) * credit_risk(i)) for all collaterals i backing u
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8086-a6b3-d20644ab3e77
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.5.2 - Total Debt Backed - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Total Debt Backed (
total_debt_backed(u)
) for each underlying market (
u
) is calculated as the sum of the Debt Backed (
debt_backed(i)
) for each collateral (
i
) backing that market.


total_debt_backed(u) = sum(debt_backed(i)) for all collaterals i backing u
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-804b-bab8-fa8216cfa71d
~~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.5.3 - Calculation Of Risk Weighted Assets - core
~~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~~The Risk Weighted Assets (
RWA(u)
) for each market (
u
) is calcualted as the product of the Total Debt Backed (
total_debt_backed(u)
) and the Weighted Credit Risk (
weighted_credit_risk(u)
).


RWA(u) = total_debt_backed(u) * weighted_credit_risk(u)
~~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8035-9345-e23a60f89e29
~~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.4.6 - First Loss Capital - core
~~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~~Finally, the First Loss Capital (
FLC(u)
) required for each market 
u
 is the Risk Weighted Assets (
RWA(u)
) multiplied by three times 2.75%, reflecting that 100% weight is being placed on Credit Risk and 0% weight on Market Risk and Liquidity Risk.


FLC(u) = RWA(u) * (0.0275 * 3)


The total First Loss Capital required across all markets is simply the sum of the First Loss Capital required for each market.
~~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-802d-a790-e4ae02e0a977
~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.1.1.1.1.5 - Reference Implementation - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~The file herein contains an initial implementation of the calculations for a lending market that can be used as a reference implementation. This implementation will be improved and optimized in future iterations of the risk framework.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8078-a2f8-f3a134d19066

~~~content:
~~~The documents herein define the implementation of the smart contract risk framework. This implementation will be specified in a future iteration of the Atlas.
~~~hub urls:

~~~A.3.3.2.3 - Admin Risk Implementation - core
~~~content:
~~~The documents herein define the implementation of the admin risk framework. This implementation will be specified in a future iteration of the Atlas.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~--------------------
~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8032-a099-ec14aeb671e6
~~~A.3.3.2.4 - First Loss Capital Update Process - core
~~~content:
~~~The documents herein define the process for updating First Loss Capital requirements.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:

~~~~A.3.3.2.4.1 - Schedule For Updating Parameters - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define the requirements for updating inputs to the calculation of First Loss Capital requirements.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-802f-8798-c59aa7382a26
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80da-867a-e4eff3b95d5a

~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80da-867a-e4eff3b95d5a
~~~~~A.3.3.2.4.1.1 - Real Time Updates - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~Inputs into First Loss Capital calculations that are based on market or other external variables should be updated in real time or immediately after the underlying data is updated, if the underlying data is only updated periodically.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-803c-bd01-c6d5d140de44
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-803c-bd01-c6d5d140de44
~~~~~~A.3.3.2.4.1.1.1 - Responsibility For Cost Of Real Time Updates - core
~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~Star Agents may develop data feeds that update the Atlas with their data at their expense. Alternatively, the Operational Executor Agent that has an Executor Accord with the Star Agent may perform this as part of the services it provides to the Star Agent. In this case, the Operational Executor Agent may charge whatever fees for this service the parties mutually agree on.
~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e8-8ace-dca92b97f42d
~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~~~id: 1b3f2ff0-8d73-80e8-8ace-dca92b97f42d
~~~~~~~A.3.3.2.4.1.1.1.1 - Near Real Time Updates By BA Labs - core
~~~~~~~content:
~~~~~~~In the near term, BA Labs will provide real time data regarding major lending markets. BA Labs will be compensated for this work as part of its existing relationship with Sky Core and Spark.
~~~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-802f-8798-c59aa7382a26
~~~~~A.3.3.2.4.1.2 - Non-Real Time Updates - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~In the near term, Star Agents may update calculations that are based on market or other external variables less frequently than real time. If they do so, Operational GovOps must apply a buffer to each variable that is not updated in real time to account for the fact that the variable may change in a way that increases the First Loss Capital requirements between update frequencies.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8074-a798-dc1fdba8b18f
~~~~A.3.3.2.4.2 - Data Maintenance And Integrity - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define processes to maintain and ensure the integrity of data that is used as an input to First Loss Capital calculations.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-801e-83e9-eccc6d22a0a2
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a9-ab68-ff63f024dbd4
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80d6-9391-d0a2e9fc4894

~~~~~A.3.3.2.4.2.1 - Responsibility For Data Updates - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~The Star Agent may assume responsibility for updating the inputs to the First Loss Capital calculations itself, either directly or through one of its agents, or may contract with Operational GovOps to perform that function.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80a9-ab68-ff63f024dbd4
~~~~~A.3.3.2.4.2.2 - Verification Of Data Updates - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~If Operational GovOps does not perform the data updates, it must verify their accuracy.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80d6-9391-d0a2e9fc4894
~~~~~A.3.3.2.4.2.3 - Penalties For Late Data Updates - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~In the near term, Operational GovOps must reduce exposure to any Asset Allocation Conduit if the Star Agent responsible for that Conduit fails to provide the timely information necessary to calculate the required First Loss Capital. In the future, a system of monetary penalties must be developed to compensate Sky for the risk posed by late data submission.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-800f-97ab-de26e6d58529
~~~A.3.3.2.5 - Process For Adjusting First Loss Capital - core
~~~content:
~~~The documents herein define how changes to the required amount of First Loss Capital should be handled.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-8031-ae37-f34bdd89c8e4
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80ae-9e91-f992afeef81a
~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80ae-9e91-f992afeef81a
~~~~A.3.3.2.5.1 - Updates Due To Changed Market Parameters - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define the process for handling changes to First Loss Capital requirements due to changes in market or other external variables.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-805d-9836-e3fe266bd088
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-805d-9836-e3fe266bd088
~~~~~A.3.3.2.5.1.1 - Immediate Update To First Loss Capital Requirements For Changes In Market Or External Variables - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~To the extent that a market or external variable changes in a way that increases the required First Loss Capital, the Star Agent is immediately responsible for supplying the additional First Loss Capital and is subject to penalties for any period in which this First Loss Capital is not provided. It is the responsibility of the Agent to maintain sufficient capital so that they remain well capitalized in the face of changes to market conditions.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8031-ae37-f34bdd89c8e4
~~~~A.3.3.2.5.2 - Updates Due To Changed Methodology Or Governance Parameters - core
~~~~content:
~~~~The documents herein define the process for adjusting First Loss Capital requirements whenever Sky Governance modifies the underlying methodology/parameters governing FLC calculations, thereby altering the FLC each Star Agent must hold.
~~~~hub urls:
~~~~child ids:
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80aa-960c-db42804e3932
~~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c9-b8a4-d8b39bdef140
~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80aa-960c-db42804e3932
~~~~~A.3.3.2.5.2.1 - Phased Update To First Loss Capital Requirements For Changes In Methodology Or Governance Parameters - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~To the extent that a change to the implementation of the First Loss Capital framework or a parameter set by Sky Governance changes the First Loss Capital requirements, the additional First Loss Capital required will phase in over time. The Star Agent must provide 50% of the additional First Loss Capital within seven (7) calendar days of the change, and the remaining 50% on a pro rata basis over the following twenty one (21) calendar days.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-80c9-b8a4-d8b39bdef140
~~~~~A.3.3.2.5.2.2 - No Penalties For Changes In Methodology Or Governance Parameters In Near Term - core
~~~~~content:
~~~~~In the near term as the First Loss Capital implementation continues to be developed, Star Agents will not be subject to penalties for failing to supply the incremental capital required by changes to the First Loss Capital implementation. However, Operational GovOps must reduce the exposure to Allocation Conduits managed by the Star Agent to bring it back into compliance with capital requirements if the Star Agent does not work in good faith to provide the additional capital on the timeline specified above.
~~~~~hub urls:
~~~~~child ids:
~~~~~--------------------
~~~id: 1b2f2ff0-8d73-8011-a303-faf05294e95a
~~~A.3.3.2.6 - Monitoring And Penalty Mechanisms - core
~~~content:
~~~The documents herein define monitoring and penalty mechanisms.
~~~hub urls:
~~~child ids:
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b6-a919-e9eb7daa7a39
~~~1b2f2ff0-8d73-80b9-b744-ec15d70a7560
